headline: Thanks again to Andre for your prompt…

headline: Very disappointed
reviewBody: Very disappointed, I planned on taking this to get my CIPD lol 3 in HR but since I recently changed my profession and my job told me there's no hope in transferring to HR I now have to cancel everything. I'm still within my 14 days allowance and tried numerous times to reach out to avado after my recent discussion with Student Support to cancel and get my refund since I still have a month before the 1st course starts and I'm within my 14 days and only 1 -2 more days before it's over and no one is replying or helping me, how do they expect someone to even complete enrollment if they don't even respond within 3 days, totally unacceptable.

headline: Great customer care!
reviewBody: Great customer care!

headline: Very helpful with queries and issues
reviewBody: Very helpful with queries and issues.  The response time in February when I started the course wasn't great, but the team are highly responsive now and in particular, I'd like to single out Andre who demonstrated genuine customer care.  Thanks Andre!

headline: about amending system error
reviewBody:
Dear Mr. Andre
Thank you very much settle for my system error soon.

headline: TERRIBLE SUPPORT
reviewBody:
Avado cancelled their accounting courses and forcing us to go to a new provider. Since this they have stopped supporting accounting students despite forcing us to finish our current level with them.

Student services take about a week to reply, and the AAT tutor, Paul Buzzard, gives you a maximum of 5 word responses to email which is extremely unprofessional and clearly doesn't give a crap about helping, probably there to claim more money as long as he can.

headline: Unfortunately disappointing
reviewBody:
Lack of consistency. Lack of communication. Lack of clarity. Lack of support from 'student support'. - Not what you would expect given the price of the course. 

Noticed especially in the last unit of the course, when majority of the students passed, and a handful of us were referred with the SAME feedback (literally a copy and paste job), on detail that the others were passed on. The marking criteria is obviously not the same across all markers. I escalated the matter to Student Support who literally took weeks to reply. (They actually replied after I had already come to a resolution with my tutor after i went to her following the lack of response). 
If you cannot guarantee a response in 3 days - don't advertise it as that. I don't think i got a response that quick from them throughout the full year. 

It has now been over 5 weeks since the last submission I made; others in my group have received an email to show completion and an e-certificate. I haven't (along with others in the group too) haven't received a thing. Again, the lack of consistency across the board is ridiculous and unfair. 

There also seemed to be a constant lack of clarity around the criteria in Tutor Support Session - what the question said on paper, and then what was actually expected when explained by the tutor - Two totally different things!!

I am a returning student/customer, i did my L3 CIPD when this company was under a different name and had no problems at all and would have recommended all day long. But this time has been totally different, I haven't enjoyed it as much, I have had to chase up a lot of responses; overall not great at all.

headline: I am currently completing HRM Level 5
reviewBody: I am currently completing HRM Level 5. Being out of education for a number of years, i found the course well structured and the tutors are excellent at answering questions and giving guidance. The content is relevant and up to date.

headline: Level 5 CIPD
reviewBody: I have recently completed my CIPD level 5 with Avado.  I couldn’t have asked for a better service. The on line content was informative and clear. The on line classes were extremely informative and our Lecturer answered email queries quickly. I liked the facts we could ask questions so others in the cohort could see and also add comments.  I would and have recommended Avado to anybody considering studying.

headline: Fantastic course content
reviewBody:
Fantastic course content. Brilliant support. Very organised and well presented.
Tutor support was brilliant. All online content was appropriate, relevant and easy to navigate.
Couldn't have asked for more from an online remote course.
You are not left to your own devices like many online courses, but you are supported every step of the way. Tutors and support team on hand whenever needed. Thank you

headline: I absolutely had a fantastic experince
reviewBody: I absolutely had a fantastic experince. Great cohort, amazing support from our mentor and student success team. I've completed all within the deadlines which is actually what perfectly worked for my learning style. Brilliant VLE and the content.

headline: I had some financial issues so I…
reviewBody:
I had some financial issues so I reached out to student success and Andre was very fast to reply and answer all my questions and concerns. He helped me solve out my issue.
Thank you Andre for being supportive and helpful.

headline: Marc Perkins - Enrolment Consultant
reviewBody:
I am a HR professional with over 9 years experience. I have just enrolled onto the CIPD People Management course. 

I had so many questions before choosing Avado as the learning provider to study my CIPD.

Marc Perkins was AMAZING throughout the whole process. He was so passionate about Avado and gave me so much confidence. 

Marc thank you so much for such amazing service.

headline: Quick turn around to overcome tech…
reviewBody: Quick turn around to overcome tech problem

headline: AWFUL COMMUNICATION AND TRY TO IGNORE YOUR OFFICIAL COMPLAINTS
reviewBody: I made an official complaint on 20/04/2021 and absolutely nothing has yet been resolved. I've spoken now to 4 different people, one Enrolment Consultant and three people from Student Success Team including getting passed to the Student Success Team Leader, none of whom have tried to resolve my matter. I have sent them everything they require for my complaint including the evidence they requested, and every single email I've had back are generic automated messages which have no relevance to my complaint, and are not addressing anything I have specifically sent to them. And then they try to close my complaint which they have not even addressed and have clearly have not even read. They keep telling me their policy is to get back within 3 working days yet the last email I had from them was 10/05/2021 and they have not responded to me since. It seems as though they are purposefully ignoring me so they don't have to deal with my complaint and are holding onto £3,000 of my money for a mis-sold service. I would strongly advise to not use this criminal company, they have broken their own Terms & Conditions and have horrid (basically non-existent) customer service.

headline: Avado --- Avadon't
reviewBody:
I have experienced the following issues with Avado and their Virtual Learning Campus (VLC).

*Outdated information - not relevant to assessment briefs.
* Missing/broken links.
* Hidden costs to access reference material.
* Missing text (paragraphs stop halfway through).
* Grammatical errors throughout.
* Directly copied lesson material sourced from external websites and passed off as Avado's own content (no referencing). 
* The VLC crashes frequently, after the most recent update, I am left with 100+ notifications that I am unable remove. 

Live tutorials

During a live tutorial session, my tutor advised that one specific assessment question was so badly constructed and vague, they advised that they will complain on our behalf to have it amended ...for the next cohort.

Whilst on the topic of tutors, when I have requested assistance or clarification, I have on occasion received vague and contradictory information from two tutors which is not helpful in the slightest. Surely information should be supplied in a standardized fashion and not be poles apart.

When you do try to email, or book a call to try and figure out what exactly it is that you're being asked to submit - please don't expect a swift reply - 5 days is normal if at all.

I had to email Student Services three times before they kindly sent me a response asking me to list, in detail, all their issues. 

The point is, that I should not have to list their faults, there shouldn't be any. When you are paying close to £2,000.00 you expect a polished and professional course. 

I would advise anyone looking into studying a HRM course that you do not go with Avado distanced learning but instead, go to a local college/evening- school where you have the opportunity to speak to someone.

I had such high hopes for this course, but Avado over promised and under delivered.

To add some context, I gained a 1st class undergraduate degree with the highest grades in my year, yet this level 3 course was extremely difficult due to the way materials were presented and the vagueness of questions posed, the course was the worst academic undertaking I have experienced to date.

Addendum 1 :
Please provide an email address (preferably not Student services - due to the waiting time) so that I am not required to place my personal contact details on a public forum.

Addendum 2: 24/05/2021

I have not yet had a reply to my email detailing my issues, this was sent on 15/05/2021. This delay in response is exactly what I have outlined above. This delay does not meet your advised 3-5 day response time. I may have to accept that this will not be resolved as the case has been so far. 

Addendum 3.
I have emailed student success on the 15/05/2021 as advised above. Still no answer, is there any point at this late stage? Seriously poor customer service.


Addendum 4: 6/6/21
Still awaiting a response...

headline: Not able to post on forums
reviewBody: I was not able to post on forums and with that to complete the tasks in the csmpus. I’ve contacted the support team and Andre provided me with quick and professional solution.Thank you!

headline: I was given an extension for my…
reviewBody: I was given an extension for my assignment and when I went to submit, the submission was not open. My tutor was OOO so I rang the student services team where I was reassured another tutor or my tutor will open up the submission when he returned., he returned from annual leave on Wednesday. I went to check the submission on Wednesday and it said I was 12 hours late, I was not told the submission was open so I was very stressed as I didnt want to miss another deadline with it not being my fault. I rang Student Services on Wednesday where David answered my call, he reassured me it was fine and he will speak to my tutor to open the submission and to not panic. Seeing as I was off on stress leave,  David helped a lot to calm my anxiety and he spoke to the Tutor and got the submission open. I was very relieved and happy David was able to sort this for me so promptly and efficiently, thank you :)

headline: Very friendly and always happy to help.
reviewBody:
Very friendly and always happy to help.
Thank you very much for the wonderful support!

headline: Five stars to Emma only!
reviewBody: I completed my course last year October but, I did not receive my certificate due to technical issues. I called student success and enquired a few times but, every person I spoke to we’re polite but, did not get back to me with an update. However, after calling the fourth time, I spoke to Emma and she was fantastic. She got the problem solved in a couple of hours after speaking to her. She was fabulous. Thank you so much Emma for your help. I now look forward to finally receiving my certificate. All thanks to you and your efficiency. I give 5 stars to Emma.

headline: Absolutely disgusted
reviewBody:
Absolutely disgusted, these people registered me wrong in 2019 it is 2021 and they have still not corrected my registration. Which means I cannot get my certificates for my learning I finished in early 2020.  
Been back and forth with them constantly, nobody actually listens to the problem that needs doing for CIPDs system to pick me up. Would never recommend them to anyone! Absolute joke!

headline: Studying with AVADO level 5
reviewBody: Studying with AVADO level 5. The learning material is easy to understand and the platforms easy to navigate. The great part of the learning is each week is part of each section of the assignment, this gave me a focus each week to complete each part. Recorded tutor support, if unable to attend or i needed to re watch. Absolutely fantastic tutors, student success and the whole experience.  Ben from student success was absolutely brilliant sorting out my defer study leave and reinstating my  course, swiftly, corresponding via email any questions I had. He is a real asset to AVADO.

headline: Unfortunately my experience with Avado…
reviewBody: Unfortunately my experience with Avado is rather terrible. I regret I didn’t do a proper research before starting with their platform. I find it extremely unprofessional that: 1) they can’t respond to your emails for weeks; 2) they don’t pick up their phone. You can literally hang there for 30 min calling to the UK with nobody picking up. The funny thing us that I saw similar feedbacks before starting with them, but decided that it was an exception and won’t happen to me.

headline: Biggest regret
reviewBody: Horrendous company to deal with. No allowances made due to covid. Studied level 3 hr diploma and had an assignment to video myself giving a training session. Due to covid I could not do this and due to people working from home my Internet connection was not strong enough for video call. No allowances made. I'm now 5 months finished the course and no diploma in sight. Results only got sent to CIPD last week after me contacting them and demanding a refund. Have now raised a formal complaint. Absolute disgrace, do not study with them.

headline: Extremely Helpful
reviewBody: I had an issue with an old assessment and Andre promptly helped me! I didn’t explain myself well in my first email but he was still happy to help and fix my problem, and all his communication was friendly and welcoming. Thank you, Andre!

headline: Apprenticeship Experience
reviewBody:
I have only recently started an apprenticeship with Avado, but I will say the support that I have received from my LDC Perran has been superb. He has supported me through my CompTIA exam and coursework with exceptional levels of care. He has gone out of his way to find and supply any extra materials I have needed, and has really helped my managers understand the apprenticeship route into business, and has enabled them to support me as well. 
In my opinion Perrans main skill is communication. I feel as though he made it very easy to build a professional and friendly relation. This really helped me feel comfortable in reaching out and asking any questions I had. No matter how stupid I may have felt them to be, he was always happy to help! 
I wish him the best in his new role and thank him for the immense amount of help in such a shot period of time. 
Thanks Perran!
-LT (MSFT)

headline: Exceptionally poor administration.
reviewBody:
Avado have stopped teaching ACCA qualification.  The ACCA students have voted with their feet.  This company is appalling to deal with from an administration point of view.  They insisted that various forms are completed before they would transfer a credit balance to Kaplan (from the employer and from Kaplan) and each time delays and delays, and no transfer of monies to Kaplan.
The end result is that the student has paid for books personally as he can wait no longer or will have no time to prepare for the exams.  Christiana Harjot (Manager) and Isabella Dawe are in no hurry to sort out problems.  The only thing forthcoming is platitudes and no action.
Please consider carefully prior to using this organisation if you wish to be prepared for your exams in time.

headline: At the start of the apprenticeship i…
reviewBody: At the start of the apprenticeship i had alot of issues with my extra needs  such as extra time not being in place. which meant that i was set back in my apprenticeship but due to the tireless work of my LDC Perran James to get my additional needs in place and exams set up for me. Due to Perran I managed to catch up and am now on the final stages to completing my apprenticeship.

headline: My time with Avado
reviewBody: Had a great experience learning with Avado. Never any issues and had great help and support whenever I needed it from my LDC Perran James. He always found time for me and no problem was too much for him. Greatly appreciate his help

headline: Amazing learning journey
reviewBody: It was a great experience during my learning journey at AVADO. Mona Liaquat has supported me from the admission until and I got my certificate.

headline: CIPD Level 3 Certificate in People Practices
reviewBody:
From the first call I made to Avado and spoke to the Advisor (Johnathan K) regarding the CIPD Level 3 Certificate in People Practices, I was well informed of the course and what it entailed. The Advisor listened and addressed my concerns with regards to the current changes that had been made to course. After this I felt more assured and able to to use the information that was discussed to make a decision to enrol.
Student Success (Rahma) also took the time to discuss the course - which further assured me that I had made the right choice. 
The overall persona of your advisors was overwhelming and welcoming as they both provided the much needed positive encouragement. 
Impressive communication skills - Great Team!!

headline: Great training
reviewBody: Great learning materials, great tutor help ( always qick response and good explanation). I would recommend Avado. I am currently studying AAT level 2 with them.

headline: Biggest mistake going with Avado.
reviewBody:
Biggest mistake going with Avado.

Had a tutor change half way through the course which i wasn't happy about as i enjoyed the tutor i had at the time as they were very helpful and answered the questions we're asking. Was slow at getting back to us but thats fine.

New tutor isn't that great or helpful! Doesn't explain what we're asking and looks like they're scripted when doing cohort sessions.

Half the information is outdated and incorrect. The mini tests you do tell you you've answered wrong but its correct. Its just a lot of words on the screen if anything.

Changed from doing a diploma to a certificate due to the stress and just wanting to get it over and done with now but still paying diploma money...

Personally wouldn't recommend Avado as they just seem to care about your money rather than your qualification you work towards.

FYI 14 days isn't long enough to decide whether the course if right for you or not. I got 3 months in before i realised its not for me but having to carry on with it due to the amount of money i'm having to pay for it!

Avado should also consider different alternatives for students who find it hard to be recorded/videoed as i've broken down multiple times over these 'pratical' exams and find them extremely difficult to par take in them but was just fobbed of with 'its part of your course'. Extremely disheartening. 

Explore your options thoroughly before you go through with this!!

headline: Group Feedback
reviewBody: I was having issues rating my group mates on their project contribution and the support team did it manually for me.

headline: Was onboarded through an employer in…
reviewBody: Was onboarded through an employer in late 2018 and have just passed my end point assessment. Has taken me longer than I initially expected to complete the apprenticeship but I felt like Avado were finding their feet a bit initially and once the teething issues were resolved then I did enjoy the course. Was fortunate to be able to attend classroom study weeks which helped and having a trainer like Darshana for these weeks was great as he was so knowledgeable and was a great teacher. In addition I have had a few learning development coaches during my apprenticeship, however both my most recent ones (Ajibola and Krutika) were both great and to be honest Krutika got me back on track over the last few months of my apprenticeship as in all honesty I was beginning to lose focus. All in all a generally positive experience but can't speak highly enough of those employees mentioned. I completed a Level 4 in Data Analytics.

headline: CIPD Level 5 Diploma with AVADO
reviewBody: The Learning Journey With Avado was excellent with good interaction. Knowledge sharing is good. the CIPD Course was practically and informative. A BIG thanks to my tutor (Grant Ward) He Was enthusiastic and really aware of what he is explaining. The course helped me to  build confidence and advance in my career, It was  Valuable experiences and learning.

headline: Great experience
reviewBody: I have really enjoyed studying with Avado, the content has been relevant, interesting and helpful throughout. The tutor support and knowledge has been fantastic and its great being part of a cohort as you know that you're able to reach out for help if needed.

headline: CIPD level 3
reviewBody:
I thought the course was really well structured, and the deadlines for submitting assessments after each module work well to keep you on track.
I had an amazing tutor (shoutout to Jacqui King!) who was really supportive, the online classes were very helpful and recordings are always available if you can't make it live or want to re-watch it. She also sent regular emails of help and encouragement to keep us going.
Didn't quite give 5 stars as the student Success replies were slow maybe they've sorted any issues out now.

headline: Great Company
reviewBody: I am near the end of completing my CIPD level 5 course with Avado. Over the last 14 months they have been great. The content of the course is thorough, the live tutor support classes are so helpful, and my tutor was always on hand for any support. I would definitely recommend Avado to anyone.

headline: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
reviewBody:
Honestly the worst company. 

Emailed my tutor multiple times for help during the course and got no response. Later went on to complete an assessment and two months later it has still not been marked. Which is beyond a joke. I have emailed the company asking what is going on (multiple times), just to be told that someone will email me to help, but still have heard nothing from them. 

There are so many grammatical errors within their textbooks, it does not read right and makes you feel stupid because it doesn't make sense. They have clearly not been proofread. As there are sentences repeated.  

The online tests that you complete clearly haven't been properly checked, it marks your answer as wrong, and then the correct answer is literally the one you have written. It doesn't even explain why your answer is wrong when you have genuinely got it wrong, which would be extremely helpful. As otherwise you are left clueless. 

I seriously regret signing up to complete levels 2, 3, and 4 of the AAT course because this company is awful. Listen to the bad reviews because they are all completely true.

headline: L3 Infrastructure Technician Apprenticeship
reviewBody: Just finished an L3 Infrastructure Technician apprenticeship. My LDC, Perran James, was wonderful throughout the whole process and I will honestly miss working with him. Thank you for everything.

headline: Thank you for everything
reviewBody: Thank you for everything. Thank you, Leo! Detailed information was given. Everything was clear.

headline: When speaking to one advisors on…
reviewBody: When speaking to one of the advisors on the phone I felt that the answers that were given to my questions were being read off a screen. I also asked questions about prices and said from what I’ve seen the prices are ‘xyz’ the advisor then said let me check that for you and repeated the exact thing I said so obviously wasn’t really listening to me. Then when I emailed to say thank you for advice but I’ve decided to go for a different company I got an essay long response about why I’d chosen the wrong company and said that I had been dismissive and hadn’t discussed options. Excuse me! How rude, I’d spoken on the phone to the advisor as well as emailed questions and done my research online, how dare you suggest i had been ‘dismissive’. Very glad I did choose someone else now as they’ve been utterly fantastic.

headline: CIPD Level 5 Diploma
reviewBody:
I enrolled today to study my CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HR Management, and after a long time analyzing learning providers (even with a comparison in Excel🤓), I decided to study with Avado. Cheryl Ball has been an amazing support during this decision time, she’s patient, candid and has a great knowledge of what Avado offers. 

Looking forward to start my studies. 

Melissa G.

headline: Great!
reviewBody:
I'm enjoying the course that I'm doing. The study material is great and the tutors are really helpful. I've had to ask for extensions on deadlines over the past few months due to personal circumstances. I was so worried about this, literally would lie awake all night fretting and convincing myself I'd be thrown off the course but once I spoke to them Avado were actually really helpful with this and gave me the time I needed. 
I had to email the Student Success team over the Christmas break and I had quick and polite responses from Andre. Thank you Andre! Very friendly and professional.

headline: Very disappointed with the service
reviewBody:
Very disappointed with the service I have received. I bought and paid for AAT level 4 and have had issues since day one. It took weeks for my tutor to realise he was my tutor.  The videos do not always load and they are on at 6pm. I work full time and cannot get home in time to be able to watch these live and to engage with them. The books have spelling and grammar mistakes and the online tasks often mark correct answers as incorrect. The online portal displaying the progress bar of each element does not update It is incredibly disheartening. I complained and was basically told ‘yes we know and sorry’ oh that makes the amount of money I have spent seem worth it. They changed the online portal three months after I started and it is not for the better-you used to be able to read each chapter in sections and now it just has each chapter as one large pdf. You may aswell just read the books which makes you wonder why you are paying for remote learning

They state you get NUS subscription but I tried and could not redeem due to it being a remote course 

Due to Covid-I have not been able to sit my exams so am behind in that regard but my online access ends in May of this year 

The positive is that the salesman are really helpful.

I have tried searching for my enrolment number that it asks for so that they can find who you are but cannot see that I have been given one

Edited: I had a reply stating someone would get in contact ‘this week’ that was 16 days ago. I have not heard anything

headline: Superb Digital Marketing course at Avado
reviewBody:
The entire course module at Avado is very engaging. 

The build up to the deeper, more involving, content is fantastic. One will come out richer with great knowledge and with a practical hand, than just a theory session. The 'group activities' make you do more interactive work and generate more knowledge and gain different viewpoints of the subject. 

The Student Success team is another ace at Avado and they are willing to go the extra length when you need them. Andre at the Student Success team is a an outstanding and very helpful person. A big thanks to Andre.   

I would like to thank Avado for designing such a great Digital Marketing course.

headline: They are happy to take your cash off…
reviewBody: They are happy to take your cash off you. I signed up in February 2018. The books arrived. I read the books immediately. Full of hope. I did all the stuff. There were spelling mistakes and other mistakes frequently. How are you expected to give a correct answer in an exam when the course material says something else? Here's my main issue. You do a section, then an exam. But when you are finishing one section, you are encouraged to read the next section, which is when you are revising for an exam. The online classes frequently you can't see or hear the tutor. And they don't contact you when you have a question. I did a course with the OU years ago-they were excellent. Why can't you just sit the exams right at the end like you do at school? You are reading the next module when revising for an exam. Never bother with these people. £1500 wasted. If I could give minus stars I would. Plus they don't really explain to you that you have to join AAT. And after it was all over for me, no contact from them. Two and a half years later, absolutely no contact from them.

headline: Poor Tutor attitude and response times
reviewBody:
This is frustrating with Avado.

This is sold as a fully flexible course with online course material and tutors that are readily available. 

The material is online and the support sessions are recorded and available soon after. However, as experienced in the recent module I have done the assignment required approval of a title from a tutor, who only responded once in the last 48 hours of the deadline and then after I complained to him with 3 hours to go before the deadline, I get a response just saying "I would advise to approve your title well in advance". Except the 6 week course module is cut to a 2 week window to do the assignment as you need the support sessions to fully understand what you need to do on the assignments - which are not run until the last two weeks of the module. *rolls eyes*

Also, when raised to the tutor that I expected a better response, I was told by him that he doesn't work weekends so he is going out of his way - so why do they set a deadline of midnight Sunday if they aren't going to respond in the last two days???

Joke of an attitude. They act as if you are doing this course it is your number 1 priority and everything else in your life should revolve around their schedule - which completely goes against the whole point of a flexible course - which it clearly is not!

headline: Perran James made up for Avado
reviewBody:
Avado are a decent company but can be a little disorganised. My learning coach Perran James did everything he could to eliminate the disorganisation but it was often out of his control. 

Regarding my learning coach i could not of asked for a better coach, Perran made every aspect of the apprenticeship as smooth and simple as he could. The constant support he provided regarding the work and personal circumstances shows he really cares and wants the best for his apprentices.   He made me believe in myself and built my confidence throughout. He worked so hard to make sure i could achieve the best i could.

headline: Level 3 Infrastructure Technician
reviewBody:
Just finished my Level 3 Infrastructure Technician course. My LDC, Perran James, was brilliant the whole way through, giving me all the support, encouragement and resources I needed to succeed.

I couldn't of asked for a better person to guide me through this apprenticeship.

I would definitely recommend Avado to anyone seeking an apprenticeship!

headline: I would recommend Avado to anyone
reviewBody: I would recommend Avado to anyone, I have just completed my Software Developer Level 4 apprenticeship with them and the help and support has been excellent. My LDC Perran has been absolute brilliant, and an endless source of support for anything work or personal. Thank you.

headline: A brilliant blend of different learning…
reviewBody: A brilliant blend of different learning styles including group work, online materials and live webinars.  I really enjoyed this, and it was great to collaborate and learn with my fellow 'squares'

headline: Recommend
reviewBody:
I want to give Naseeba, who was my second LDC a big shout-out because without her, I don't think I would have finished this apprenticeship. She pushed me to do the best I could and always showed she had faith in me. Helped me to do all my exams and pass them and helped with my coursework and etc.

She even spent time out of her work hours to help with getting this apprenticeship completed . Also made sure to have an End point assessment set in place before she left the company.

Want to give her a big thank you for going above and beyond for me!! 

They should give her a bonus haha.

headline: Horrendous experience
reviewBody: Do not use this company. Paid for an accountancy course, had a family member pass away so was unable to complete the course at all, Tried to get even a PARTIAL refund for goods and services which I have paid for and not received(exam fees books etc) no response from the company whatsoever. I believe a business should show some sort of empathy and be understanding that spending 2.5K to receive NO SERVICES OR GOODS, NOT EVEN ONE ONLINE CLASS, for them to not show any consideration and offer a refund is totally unacceptable and unethical. Shambles of a company, put me in real financial stress, DO NOT USE

headline: I feel like I was conned
reviewBody:
I feel like I was conned out of the money by a salesman that came into my home (pre covid)  and preyed on a single lady that was quite vulnerable after just giving birth.
I was given misinformation and persuaded to setup the direct debit. I have been told I cannot get a refund and I should pick a new course. 
Quite frankly I’d like to walk away from the whole company but I still feel raw this has happened.

headline: Recommend
reviewBody: I was looking to stat my CIPD level 5 course and I spoke to Mohammad on the phone and then via email. He was professional and courteous and filled me with the confidence needs that I would get the necessary support throughout my studies.

headline: Who is giving Avado anything above 0…
reviewBody:
Who is giving Avado anything above 0 stars??? Honestly it’s hilarious! I’m here again writing another review.

I am on the April Cohort and am doing 3PRM unit at the moment, from start to finish this course has been a disaster and it’s the majority on my cohort that feels the same. 3 weeks before the assessment is due we are given a new tutor who is even WORSE than the one we had before. I have been calling and emailing Avado since Monday and have had no response!!! Disgusting vile company. 3 more modules to go and then il be happy to see the back of Avado!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME GIVING THEM YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY BECAUSE THEY DO NOT CARE TRUST ME!!!

headline: Good expierence
reviewBody: Good expierence. Perran supported me well with both my work and personal issues. A fantastic mentor. 5 STARS!

headline: The experience was very good because…
reviewBody:
The experience was very good because support team was understanding of my problem and they extended the best support possible. 
However, I had to write two reminders because it was already later than the tat mentioned in the automated reply.
That is why I have given 3 stars and not 5 even though the support provided was satisfactory.

headline: I wouldn't recommend AVADO…
reviewBody:
I wouldn't recommend  Avado learning they take your money and don't care about you!!!!
I have a very very bad experience with them .
Before you think to pay them look at complain about them . I didn't see something like this never in my life .

reviewBody:

headline: Level 4 Data Analyst
reviewBody:
I have just completed a Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship with Arch.

I received amazing support from Arch and especially from my LDC Krutika Patel. Krutika always strived for me to achieve a distinction and without her knowledge and support it would not have been possible.

headline: Avoid this company like the plauge they…
reviewBody: Avoid this company like the plauge they take your money sign you up for something completey unsuitable and when you want support or advice they dont care. I am writting this on behalf of my mum who is in hospital on chemotheraphy and unable to contiunue with the course orginally she asked to change and pospone but they ignored her firstly when they finally resonded after she contacted them again and again they finally answered after 9 weeks offering a new course but at this point illness has taken a further development and due to COVID unable to leave hosiptal or make contact , I have contacted AVADO - David several times but completley incompident we offered AVADO to keep the money we had paid over £800 and refund finance company the balance however the refused in the meantime the finance company chasing a women in hospital with cancer . The course was not what they said tutior just reads out what people are writting as questions through out the online tutorial no contact if you are not logging on or attending or submitting work just take your money and leave you . I would urge anyone thinking of using this company to think again and then look else where a complete disgrace and we will be taking legal action

headline: Just finished my last assessment
reviewBody: Just finished my last assessment - I can say it truly happy that I took this decision a year ago. I was doubting if I should start bachelor degree in HR or CIPD. I had great experience, and the tutor  Paul was amazing support along the way, he sometimes took his time to reply even during the weekends. He showed his expertise of all the topics we covered and he is great motivator. Furthermore I have got my first internship in HR just after 3 months after starting. Really recommend who wants fast track their career in HR!

headline: CIPD HR Level 5
reviewBody:
CIPD HR Level 5
It’s a shame this college has such a good reputation but does it really? or it’s just a hoax. 
I’ll let you know what you're looking at if you are considering an online course with them right now.
Where do I start
1) They say that everything in the course like online study material is available on their learning campus. The leaning provided are mostly google links and other websites which you need to buy membership of to view their articles.
2) Avado says they have a 24 hour student support system but when you email the tutor they take 3 days to respond. And if you call the actual support number they will put on hold for more than 10 mins only to realise that you need to email the tutor. 
3) The tutor sessions cuts out very frequently because of poor internet connectivity at tutors home. Yes, she works from home and does not bother spending more money on a better broadband package.
4) Tutor sessions are recorded to help you view them later in case you missed. However, you cannot rely on them because their recoding software does not work. And there will be no recorded sessions for you to view. 
5) The tutors are cryptic in responding to questions and confuses everyone, including themselves during tutor sessions. And if asked about anything generally will say google it.
6) If you want to change tutor or the cohort as they are really that bad, yes you can, at a price of £250 and then you will have to wait for a space in another course. Which they won’t tell you how long.
Well done Avado keep up the good work!
P.S. the assignment on the photo attached is due on the 13th December... they say on there website that it’s due on 13 November is this some kind of Friday the 13th joke? Or is the joke on you once again...

headline: Answering Queries
reviewBody:
Rahma was very helpful and very patient with all my queries which she was able to answer them and I really appreciate her support 

Wish the team all the very best!

Regards
Samhar

headline: The Avado team was quick to answer my…
reviewBody: The Avado team was quick to answer my query and took care of my concern right away.

headline: Informative and straightforward.
reviewBody: Very informative and simple process to sign up and get started.

headline: Level 4 Data Analyst
reviewBody:
Data Analyst 

Overall a really great experience, the course material was fantastic the tutors were exceptional especially Darshana and Don. My coach Perran was unbelievably friendly, supportive and welcoming. I can’t recommend enough I look forward to completing a higher lever qualification with them

headline: Good and fast support by Andre..
reviewBody: Good and fast support by Andre... thanks.

headline: If I would give a lower score I would
reviewBody:
If I would give a lower score I would. 
They have scammed me well and proper.
I signed up for the CIPD Level 3 Diploma course. Via one of their sales agents Marc Perkins. I've got emails confirming that I've signed up for this course, that would cost me £1,500 as it was on discount at the time. 
Yet, when I've started the course, the Student Success team has told me that I've been signed up for the Certificate level instead. 
I've sent they through the proof of this, my email thread with Marc, plus they can listen to my phone call with him of necessary, in which I've detailed my desire to participate in the Diploma level course. 
The student success team have now decided to ignore me. I'm currently still waiting for a response to an email I sent on the 16 th of Oct. 
In the meantime, they're still happy to continue to take my money, and not provide the services promised. 
I'm very disappointed with Avado and the service received.
Nobody seems to want to help me, referencing a mistake that they have made.

UPDATE.

Following this review, I was contacted by the student success team, and they have since resolved my problem and apologised for the situation. 
Shame I had to go to this length to receive a response. But at least its sorted now. Guess I've got TrustPilot to thanks for that!

headline: My tutor did not communicate with me.
reviewBody: I have had both problems involving technology and my tutor with Level 2.  I am supposed to be studying Sage One module yet I cannot access it despite signing up for the free 3 months with Sage.  I have no way of knowing whether other people have had this problem because the community forum is not user friendly.  My tutor has not answered any of my emails so have had to speak to someone more senior who was very helpful.  I have had to watch other tutors' class recordings because they are usually an hour instead of half an hour. I feel I have been completely on my own.  It takes an age to contact student services via the phone. Avado cannot use the Covid 'working from home' excuse because the tutors all work from home anyway!  I have had to buy extra study material because the study materials are not sufficient to be able to do well in the assessments.

headline: Mona was very helpful and informative.
reviewBody: Mona was very helpful and informative.

headline: Level 3 infrastructure Apprenticeship
reviewBody: My Experience with Arch has been good. have had some issues with communications within the company taking awhile but other then that they were able to pick up from where my old Apprenticeship company failed and help complete my Course. My LDC Perran James has helped me throughout my time from Course Work to exam resources and even though he seems overworked from the amount of apprentices he is assigned he is able to reply and help quickly. Would also like to thank the Lecturer Kat Brown who without er help i would never of passed the Coding and logic exam.

headline: Level 4 Software Dev: D. Robertson
reviewBody:
Over all my experiance with Avado has been really good.
MY LDC Perran James, is really down to earth easy to talk to has a good understanding of the field that I studied. Lots of useful advice helped me focus on the areas needing attention and gave me the confidence to really go for it with my apprenticship.

I only have one critisism and that would be the work loads on each LDC is making it harder for them to spend more time when needed, but hats of to Perran he always was able to find time to help when needed.

Will miss my catch up calls and general banter!

Cheers Avado. (more so thanks Perran)

headline: IT Infrastruct Technician L3
reviewBody: I have had an excellent experience with arch, my LDC Perran James has always gone above and beyond to help where needed. I have now passed my apprenticeship, I would highly recommend Arch

headline: Revision materials are shambles.
reviewBody: Currently studying level 2, absolutely gutted that I've chosen to pay for level 2, 3 and 4 before realising how terrible the revision/reading material is. Over the past few months I've noticed mistakes, pages missing, all sorts of problems in the material, but today is just the icing on the cake. A chapter in the online reading material and the exact same chapter in the physical book, give you different answers, how are you meant to get the correct answer sitting the exam when one platform gives you one answer and another platform gives you the opposite? Especially if you only choose to do revision via the online resource, and its the books that has the correct material. Ridiculous.

headline: Level 4 Data Analyst Programme
reviewBody:
Throughout my apprenticeship I have received amazing support from Arch and my LDC Krutika Patel. 

Krutika offered endless support over the 2 years and went above and beyond to help me achieve the best possible grade, with Krutika's advice and knowledge I was able to achieve a distinction which I am very happy about. 
I would highly recommend the Avado Level 4 Data Analyst apprenticeship as not only are you able to grow and develop your skillset, you also receive amazing support from all at Arch and especially in my case from Krutika!

headline: The services team always go above and…
reviewBody: The services team always go above and beyond to help me out, I honestly can’t fault them.

headline: Very Active & Useful
reviewBody: Very Active & Useful

headline: First class learning experience
reviewBody:
I had a great experience with Avado. From Grant's excellent knowledge and super approachable teaching style, to the quality of the online learning resources.

Thank you for the opportunity!
Andrew

headline: Professional & Highly Recommend!
reviewBody:
The experience that I have had with Avado for my Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship has been truly amazing!

The quality of teaching by Darshana and Don was exceptional! All of the technical theory was taught clearly, they were friendly and made sure that all students fully understood all the concepts.

And my Learning & Development Coach, Boglarka, was very professional, friendly, supportive, great listener and so good at explaining exactly what I needed to do to succeed. She is truly an expert and made the difference in me achieving a Distinction in my apprenticeship!

I would highly recommend Avado for a Level 4 Data Analyst apprenticeship.

headline: More interested in getting your money than helping students
reviewBody:
I'm overall not very happy with my experience with Avado. The sales pitch was great - while they are trying to get your money and sign up for multiple courses! I agree with a previous reviewer that the online classes aren't very consistent and when they do happen they aren't very useful. My main issue has been how they have handled things throughout the pandemic. I called to see what start dates would be available to commence level 3 (that I have already paid for) as i was worried because I still have my final exam to take for level 2 but my local exam centre had still not re-opened, and I wanted to get level 2 completed before commencing any further studies. After emailing and getting no response, and spending nearly 2 hours on the phone I finally got through to someone to be told that Avado is no longer offering AAT courses so the last cohort I could join was the one that started at the beginning of July. This was in the middle of August. I had no communication from Avado prior to this that they would be withdrawing AAT, and if you wanted to participate in a live class you would have to joon the July class, which I think is terrible customer service on their part. I was then also told that I had up until August 2021 to complete both my level 2 and 3, despite the fact my exams had been cancelled due to my local exam centres being closed and I'd not yet been able to take an exam through no fault of my own. When I pointed this out I was given a 3 month extension and told that was the maximum I could have. I have since managed to find another exam centre near me and finally get my UACS exam booked again, logged on to start revision and found I now have no access to Sage 50 as I previously did so I now can't even start my revision. I have spent the majority of the day on hold to Avado to try and find out why this is, and received an auto reply to my email to say they aim to get back to me within 3 working days. How is that helpful to me when my exam is in 2 weeks and I need to start my revision now.
Overall, for a company that claims to support their students to the highest level I have found them to be really quite unhelpful throughout the whole pandemic. 
Balancing family life with a job and studying is very challenging and I feel like Avado have made this experience so much harder than it needs to be during an already really difficult time. I have spent £2000 with this company and am so disappointed in the service I am now receiving (£2000 I paid well in advance of the due date, then had my account suspended for 2 days because of "non payment" I had to spend more time on hold then email them bank statements with proof of payment. Not a great start) I am really not looking to starting Level 3 with them and wish I had only signed up to Level 2 instead believing the sales pitch the rep gave me.

headline: Efficient and friendly
reviewBody:
John Jones was incredibly helpful and made the booking for my course extremely quick, simple and easy! 
I look forward to studying through Avado- thank you John!

headline: Helpful staff
reviewBody: Avado staff were very helpful in explaining the course sign up process and how the course is structured. I wasn't quite ready to book after my first call so requested a call back in a few weeks and received one which was great.

headline: Looking forward to my HR Course
reviewBody:
Truly pleased with my decision to continue my Human Resource experience and knowledge by enrolling into Avado's CIPD Diploma in HR: (Level 3).
Thanks Avado and Stuart Young,my course advisor who was instrumental in guiding me through this stage.
Looking forward to this exciting journey and taking the next step in my career 😘🙏🏽👍🏾

headline: Victoria Murphy and Andy Murphy
reviewBody: Victoria Murphy is my tutor and she has been of amazing support throughout my CIPD journey with AVADO. Her tutor sessions are of great value and I would have not been able to deliver my assignments at the same level without them. Vicky takes her time when explaining everything to the last detail and is always ready to answer all of the questions that arise from the students. In addition, anytime I had personal challenges she replied to me very promptly and efficiently. Andy Murphy was as well of great help when Vicky was not available. Thank you very much to both of them!

headline: Helpful advisors
reviewBody: I reviewed a few providers before choosing. Avado for my level 5 cipd diploma. I called Avado and spoke to Georgia who was really helpful and she answered my many questions patiently and had lots of knowledge about the course. I can't wait to start now!

headline: Professional
reviewBody: Professional , no pressure to sign up , received call back as promised , good clear information given

headline: Such an easy simple process to sign up
reviewBody: Such an easy simple process to sign up, can’t wait to get started

headline: Solid training & support
reviewBody: Avado delivered excellent training in data science. Our instructor was extremely knowledgable and was able to keep things simple yet still be thorough. My LDC was also very supportive, making sure I was always up to date with the programme and always giving ample advice throughout.

headline: Honest
reviewBody: Enrolment process was quick and easy, was sold all of the benefits of their virtual learning campus etc. However, having studied with Avado for a year now, I am disappointed with the tutor support and online classes. Online classes are very sporadic and when they are held do not prove very helpful. Resources available online for previously recorded classes (held by another tutor do prove helpful, which I guess is why they are the ones available to all students)

headline: Unstructured and not cohesive.
reviewBody:
The classroom material in the first two weeks suffered from repetition and sticking to high level over views and concepts, this could have easily been condensed making time for more in-depth teaching, which came in the final 2 weeks when the course leader took over.

The other two tutors were personable and obviously knowledgeable but seemed in-experienced in teaching. The first week was delivered by someone  not familiar with the slides and presented without following a logical order in a scattershot manner. The second week was taught by someone  who sat in with us watching those lessons the session before.

Support outside of the classroom was available but not well developed. One of the tutors set up a WhatsApp group but as this is a technical field more could be done to promote support between learners and encourage a culture of idea sharing/ problem solving. In my opinion and as a reference point,  Massive Open Online Courses manage this more effectively.

The LDC was very supportive, friendly, clearly invested in my progression and very capable but seemed to be overloaded with apprentices to a near unmanageable level. To be clear; I think my LDC was excellent but Avado had put too much on them.

The Covid pandemic has impacted apprenticeship delivery but I genuinely felt as though the course was being developed around me as we were going through it and was not clearly defined, which as a learner doesn't help. It just didn't come together cohesively 

My experience was a frustrating one. Its difficult to make an assessment on whether its been valuable as the qualification has yet to yield any tangible results, but I certainly feel other education providers have left me far more satisfied and confident.

headline: Not great, but okay
reviewBody:
I'm in the 3rd Unit of the HR Level 3 Diploma course. The course content is very informative and well structured, the tutors are knowledgeable and quick to respond to questions, but the Virtual Learning Campus can do with some improvement work... Some videos don't play, old links, conflicting information, grammar mistakes, sentences not finished, regular maintenance work without prior warnings,... For a company who only offer online learning this is really poor. It also takes Student Success a full week to respond to emails and follow up emails. In the end, I gave up and just hope I don't run into anymore problems.
All in all, I don't regret choosing Avado, although student experience could be improved. However, not sure if I would return for the Level 5 course.

headline: Not helpful for the students with…
reviewBody: Not helpful for the students with genuine issues in their day to day life. I called few months ago and spoke wit manage. I told them i cant pursue my course because my daughter is disabled and her major surgery is coming in mid September. Even they have their refund policy for such students. First they started avoiding me. I had to keep calling for 2 weeks just for follow-up. In the end they said they cant do refund and i was left with no choice. Very disappointed. Now i have now use of this course.

headline: Amazing support
reviewBody:
I would be hard pushed to say that my learning experience with Avado perfect (although nothing is perfect). I can say with confidence that my LDC had my back the entire way. Besides being an all around awesome individual. Mrs Krutika Patel was always there to guide me to my DISTINCTION grade. She was always kind and supportive the entire way even offering her own time to help if i needed. At times where i may have been slacking she boosted my morale and kept me on track being supportive and firm at the precise moments. At times where i had difficulty with work commitments with my apprenticeship work. Krutika really came through when I felt intimidated to voice my concerns to my employers who were supposed to also support me in my apprenticeship but was not! She made sure my issues were escalated appropriately and ultimately resolving the matter. Throughout my course i would always be asked at what level i think im performing at to which i always felt was to a merit level. Krutika would always reassure me that she believes im working at distinction level. Admittedly I thought we was only being kind by telling such. Rest assured you can trust Krutikas words as that IS what i achieved! To conclude for all the hurdles i may have come across in the Avado learning experience it is all compensated by the support you provided my Krutika. If Avado has more LDCs like Krutika then trust that you are in the right hands.

I cannot thank you enough!

headline: If I could give no stars I would…
reviewBody:
If I could give no stars I would gladly! 

DO NOT AND I REPEAT DO NOT DO ANY COURSE WITH AVADO!!!

Their material is all outdated, tutor support is minimum and the course is like trying to work out a riddle. I painfully have 5 more modules left and can’t wait to see the back of avado. I will happily give my money to ICS for my level 5 HR as I should of from the beginning, but I was fed lies from avado sales team as all they are interested in is taking peoples hard earned money.

The biggest scammers I’ve ever known. Absolutely disgusted with this organisation and never want anything to do with them again once I receive my diploma and I will keep doing reviews like this if it helps atleast one person from making a BIG mistake

headline: Best learning experience
reviewBody: I came into this appreticeship not knowing what to expect as I came from a different background. My first LDC was Ajibola Badmos. She was very supportive, understanding, and patient whilst I adjusted to a different career. Later, I was transferred to another LDC, Krutika Patel as she was more experienced with data. Krutika helped me grow and become even more confident with both my apprenticeship work and projects. She took the time to understand and see details in my work that can be/ needs to be improved. I feel truly blessed to have had Aji and Krutika as my LDC's. They are very professional but also very friendly. I feel like I owe a lot of my confidence in my work to Krutika. She was very positive and encouraging throughout our conversations. She's very knowlegable and her experience shows in her confidence. I also passed all my exams thanks to the wonderful teaching of Darshana Edirisinghe and Don Rombaoa. Before attending their class, I tried to understand the subjects that I needed to pass and found it extremely difficult. After attending their class, just from the first hour, I already learnt so much more than I could on my own and online research. My whole journey with Arch has been the best possible learning experience I could ask for. I am now more capable and confident to pursue a career in data. Thank you!

headline: Avoid at all costs!
reviewBody: Avoid at all costs!

headline: I wouldn't want organisations signing up their staff to do the course through AVADO
reviewBody:
I won't be dong a course through AVADO, it was mentioned that their material is not up to date so when researching not to use up to date material from CIPD! The assessment requirement was not clear at all, even my ex work colleague mentioned it required two tutor sessions to understand what's required, why can't something as simple as a requirement for an assessment be clear instead of needing tutor sessions. This means the course content is not clear either. 

Most serious of all they are dodgy with the financial arrangement, I am in the process of making a complaint to the financial conduct authority.

headline: Amazing worker and great course content!
reviewBody:
I was looking to enroll in a HR course to develop my skills and have another set of skills to transfer to another career if needed.
I spoke to Leon Thorton-Jones in the customer care team. He was amazing! He talked me through all the options, answered my many questions and called back twice to fit around my family on that day. He even answered my call that came after closing times so I could get set up. The course dashboard is easy, friendly to use and the information is very clear. Thank you Leo! I look forward to starting.

headline: Great buying experience
reviewBody: I found the whole experience hassle free and straight forward from start to finish.  I had a named contact from the beginning.

headline: Like banging your head against a brick wall!
reviewBody: No access to Sage One for the past six weeks but the tutor is still teaching the unit... go figure! I don’t feel that I am getting the service I was sold. Emails are replied to at the tutors convenience not the time scales that I, as the paying customer, would want. Makes me feel as if I’m a hinderance and an inconvenience as opposed to their job!

headline: Shaky start but with the right LDC I was able to push through
reviewBody: The beginning of the course was difficult due to the unclarity there was around the course and the changing of my LDC’s, however once Naseeba was assigned to me as my LDC the process was much smoother as she knew what she was talking about and was able to actively support me. Naseeba was always available when I needed her and always pushed me to do more even when I didn’t think I could do it. Without her I wouldn’t have made it to the end of the apprenticeship!

headline: L3 Infrastructure Technician
reviewBody: I've recently completed my apprenticeship with Avado, when I first joined on the the apprenticeship i came across a lot of issues with their overall management and some clashes with my employer. The length of my apprenticeship has been extended both due to COVID and poor timing on Avado's end, however my LDC, Perran James, was an absolute star the whole way through, honestly without him i'd probably have quit a long time ago. He has steered me in the right direction and given me the guidance I needed to complete the apprenticeship obtaining a distinction. 5* for the staff, not much to say for the rest.

headline: AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviewBody: Not one of the best people to help. They are just concerned about selling and making money. I couldn’t finish my course due to personal circumstances. Just after signing up for the course, I was facing separation from my partner with not even an year old child. I was constantly in contact with the student services informing them that I am unable to study due to my situation. I was offered to re-enrol with some extra fees. I agreed to to pay extra and re-started from another date but I couldn’t cope up with the personal pressure and a small child. All this while I had told them that I can’t continue. To my surprise, my outstanding amount was sent to debt collection and I told them the same thing. I barely logged into their online learning not more than 5 times and the amount I paid was way more than that. Now I am still being chased for the debt  and I am still saying that I m the only person looking after a child unable to bear the costs, but they don’t understand your situation. I can barely make ends meet but Avado would like their money first and then I can think about feeding myself and my child. I am so very stressed that I have anxiety everytime I get a email or letter. I am so stressed because of this. I am a single mother looking after a child, I cannot pay anymore to you. I don’t have the money to pay. I really want someone to write this debt off for me. Please, it is a humble request.

headline: Arch Apprentices - Data Analytics

headline: L & D CIPD with Avado - A few regrets
reviewBody:
I would like to share my experience with Avado so far. For context, I am studying one of their L & D CIPD courses. 

Like many of the positive reviews here, the best experience I had was during the sales process. Informative, consultative, they did what they committed to and it felt like an easy decision to sign up. If the course was as effective as their sales process, I was very confident it would be a great experience. 

One important thing to note, is that you can only claim a refund 14 days after purchase. Often, you will not get access to the course or the materials until the cohort/class starts, and this can be sometime after making the payment. In other words, you could be in a situation where you will not be able to request a refund when you have seen the quality of the course. 

I requested a refund during my first module. At the time I knew it was unlikely this would be granted because I was familiar with their T's and C's and the small print. Their response was fair (citing the 14 day refund period) and they offered me the alternative of deferring my course, gifting it to someone else, or exploring another course instead. None of these options really help me, because it is the approach, content and service itself that I have an issue with. 

My top tip here is to read the terms & conditions and understand their policies on refunds before you make the buying decision. Consider if you are happy to lose that money if you subsequently decide that you are not enjoying the content or the course. 

A summary of my feedback on my experience so far: 

- Course structure. Sometimes very content-heavy, other times extremely light in content. In all honesty, there have been weeks where I thought listening to a podcast or reading a couple of relevant blog posts would have advanced my learning far more than this course. 

- Convoluted structure. Often, the course content lacks a clear structure or logical order. 

- There is far less interactive elements in the course than advertised. I was told to expect a live class nearly every week, but the reality is, you typically get 2 live classes every 6-8 week period. 

- The forums on the course site are  not moderated (with the exception of the assessment forum). This means that students (with a range of experience and knowledge) can share their views completely unchecked or properly moderated by a tutor. I question the value of this, and worry that if taken at face-value, some students may follow bad advice posted here. 

- The Tutor is very helpful, responsive and thorough in his follow-up and replies. However, his scope is limited (responding to questions about the assessments purely) and he is stretched extremely thin. He looks after two "cohorts". Our cohort has over 200 people in it, and I believe the other has a similar number. It must be a lot of hard work looking after that many students and it limits the meaningful contribution a tutor can make in the course. 

- The most recent module has been an utter shambles, and I worry that members of the cohort will suffer for this when it comes to assessment. There has been a complete mismatch for weeks between the Assessment that has been set, the grading criteria and the guidance that has been given. Essentially, a mix of old and new content that has confused a huge amount of students. The tutor has worked hard to apologise and rectify this, but this was not the tutor's fault and it is not good enough from a quality-control perspective at all.

In summary, the experience falls short of what I expected during my initial discussions with Avado about the course. I am also now trapped/stuck in a position where I have to commit to over 12 months of learning that I really would rather walk away from. At an investment of over 2,000 GBP, I don't feel I can simply walk away and write that amount off, especially during these times. 

So I am committed to a learning process which I am extremely unsatisfied with for a protracted amount of time. My hope is that it improves and I begin to enjoy the content/experience. If I do, I will happily reflect that experience here in a new review. Sadly, I don't hold out much hope for that at all.

headline: Liars, thieves and unsupportive
reviewBody:

headline: Unprofessional and dodgy
reviewBody: I have recently only made an enquiry, asking about prices etc. The email I got back from them was very unclear and unprofessional. Firstly they completely misspelled my name, which I think is unacceptable for someone who tries to sell their product to you. Secondly they said that they cannot find other enquiries made by me (?) and in order to open an account (?) they need my email address - would be fair if they wouldn't already been emailing me (!) and phone number. I said back I don't need an account opened as Im looking only at my options now and refuse to be contacted by phone. In reply: standard colorful email with "it was so nice to speak with you today"... Highly unprofessional, rude and dodgy.

headline: DO NOT GO WITH AVADO!
reviewBody: DO NOT GO WITH AVADO!! They sell sell sell and say everything you want to hear, makes everything sound wonderful.... the truth is- they do not have 1-2-1 support for you. They have over a hundred people in a class. They give very little support and teaching the basics is a no!!!! For the money you at it is disgusting. Complaints have been raised and they do not care with what you say and are not interested one bit. Their process in handling issue are very very poor and don’t care. They charge people from £1800-£2500 for the same course, yes exactly the same!!!! They do scree you over and please do not go to Avado!!! REMEMBER YOU ARE JUST A NUMBER AND MONEY IS ALL THEY CARE ABOUT. They don’t care if you are stuck, even the live sessions are not even video or audio, you can only type in the sessions, that’s if you are able to get in because it exceeds number of capacity of people allowed in the sessions!!!! DO NOT FALL FOR THEIR BS! PEOPLE HAVE LEFT AND HAVE LOST MONEY BECAUSE OF THIS AND THEY DO NOT ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY. I AM TRYING TO GET OUT TOO! They will say all sorts to make it sounds friendly but it is not and they will now even respond to exactly the way they have responded to others. IN A ROBOTIC FORMAT WHICH MEANS NOTHING- check it out!

headline: Because a global pandemic isn’t enough!
reviewBody:
I’ve had one of the worse experiences with Avado so far!

I’ve registered to do a course with Avado to help me do my job and hopefully have a long career as I don’t have any qualifications related directly to my job. 

Unfortunately due the virus I lost my job in March, which is when my course was supposed to start! Frazzled and trying to get everything sorted quickly I completely forgot to cancel my course. 

When I sent emails to cancel Avado informed that I have to pay the course in FULL, despite the fact that I attended no classes and used no materials! I hadn’t even logged on the platform!! 

Now with no job, Avado has asked me to pay £100 to “halt” the process of raising the issue to a debt collection agency. 

For someone where their job depended mainly on bonuses and commission it is very difficult to make ends meet, still pay rent, bills and food. For a company who had to let go some of their employees you’d think that a global health crisis would be basis to contract termination!

I completely understand having to lose a deposit or paying an instalment, but paying for the full course which I did not use not once for a job I no longer have seems opportunistic, unpleasant and discourteous! 

I 100% do not recommend you use Avado unless you’re sure no other crisis would ever hit the world again!

headline: Really Great HR Diploma Course
reviewBody:
Avado is a really sleek, well run learning platform, I am on my final unit of the HR diploma course which I felt was the best option as they are affiliated and the official learning partner of the CIPD. 

The Virtual Learning Centre is mapped out very well and easy to use, the mix of different activities to aid understanding and studying was very good and helped understand the topics undertaken. 

Our Tutor Loretta McKay was informative, helpful, knowledgeable,really friendly and helpful. I don't think I would have passed all my units so far with minimum trouble I did without her. She is a fantastic tutor and I would recommend this course to anyone who is pursuing or in a career in HR and wants to improve their overall understanding of the subject.

headline: I am an Avado student currently…
reviewBody: I am an Avado student currently completing my final assignment for the CIPD Intermediate Diploma in HR Management. I had previously started this course with another online provider but I abandoned my studies because the course material and support were woefully inadequate. Therefore, I truly believe it is worth paying to study with Avado because the course material developed in conjunction with the CIPD is far superior to that of other providers. In addition, if you are lucky enough to be in Loretta McKay's cohort of learners, then I have no doubt that you too will succeed in completing the course. She manages in one tutor support session to demystify all of the learning material and distill it into a one-hour webinar that leaves you feeling empowered and able to take on the assignment. Throughout the 14-month course, I have felt that Loretta really cared if we were successful and when people were failing and needed the additional support, she was always available. I have no hesitation in recommending Avado as the right partner to support you on your learning journey!

headline: Scam course
reviewBody:
Scam course. Sold to me for £2,500 for level 2,3 and 4 accounting. Didn't explain at the time that wasn't all the costs. its another around £100 a year for a membership with AAT (without this you cant sit any exams) and then, each exam can cost anywhere between £70-£120 depending on how far you are willing to drive. Exams are 5 every level, so that's 5 times you've got to take a day off work for an exam - per year, and this isn't explained when you sign up to the course! it took me 18 months to do Level 2 as the tutors aren't much support or help. Its one bog standard learning centre for every student, they run live classes, which are at pm.... just as everyone gets in from work, and if you want to rewatch it you have to sit for an hour listening to the lecture and all the extra questions for everyone which is time consuming. Would never recommend to anyone. They also charge extra if you go over the 12 months they give you with barely any support. Really disappointed. Last thing, certificate doesn't even come from Avado, it comes from AAT, so essentially youre paying £2500 to Avado for them to send you some books so you can self teach!

Edit*** 7/5/2020. 
Tried contacting student services to discuss their “comment” on my review.... no surprise  but they didn’t get back to me!

headline: Software Developer Level 4 Apprenticeship
reviewBody:
I have recently finished the Level 4 Software Developer apprenticeship with Avado/Arch. During my apprenticeship, I received continued support and honest feedback from my Learning Development Coach Krutika Patel. 

Krutika clearly outlined the apprenticeship standards and held me accountable, ensuring that I was continually producing work to the highest level.This ultimately played a crucial role in helping me achieve my final grade - a Distinction! 

I am very pleased to have achieved this grade and would highly recommend Krutika and Avado/Arch Apprenticeships.

headline: This review is specifically for Perran…
reviewBody: This review is specifically for Perran James who works for Avado/Arch. Throughout my apprenticeship Perran has always supported me and offered me additional support when needed. He always let me know when the work I produced was to a high standard. Even though he had a very busy work load I still felt like I was given the time and help I needed to help me pass my Apprenticeship, even when things weren't going great. To finish this off I would just like to say Perran works ridiculously hard to make sure everyone one of us passes, even as his work load increases. The work Perran has done with me has enabled me to finish my apprenticeship and even achieve a distinction. So, I want to thank you Perran if you are reading this, I couldn't of done it without you and if it was up to me you would get a reward like a pay rise and someone to help ease your work load!

headline: Excellent enrolement process, be aware that you can't finish earlier than their shedule
reviewBody:
Fast enrolement, friendly and knowledgeable enrolement personel. My account was created in minutes. I could access content from day one, and navigate the learning platform.
A major downside is that you can't really go at your own pace which wasn't evident from their or the CIPD websites. The course advisor did however alert me that I would have to follow Avado's scheduled before I signed-up to the course.

The set up and process was quickly and efficiently handled within an hour. 

Thank you.
