headline: Great Online Learning Service
reviewBody:
Absolutely brilliant online learning service, only reason for not giving 5 stars was for the duration of my online learning course the notifications and emails were intermittent despite scheduled downtime and comms to keep all of the learners informed it never fully resolved.  
In terms of ease of use, information available, progress tracking and ease of interaction with my cohort and tutor, i would definitely recommend.

headline: Jay listened
reviewBody: Jay listened, provided detailed information, was friendly but still professional, happy to go over things, walked me through the signup process, called me when he said he would.  He gave me confidence I had chosen the right course and would gain what I needed from it.  So THANK YOU Jay, you were a great example of high quality customer service in action.

headline: Quick, friendly and easy
reviewBody: The team was so friendly and helpful, as I wasn’t sure if this would be the qualification for me. But after speaking to the team and asking questions they were so encouraging and helpful that I knew it was the qualification for me. The process from enquiry to signing up for the course couldn’t of been more fast, easy and friendly.

headline: New Member
reviewBody: I newly enrolled; however, i feel am being guided and welcomed well as a new member.

headline: A really easy process
reviewBody: A really easy process. I had lots of questions which the team answered easily and quickly.

headline: Great start to my future.....
reviewBody:
I would definitely recommend AVADO for anyone that is looking to do their CIPD. If you’re looking for a structured but still flexible learning experience this provider would be great. 
I’ve only been enrolled for just over a week. But from what I’ve seen on the VLC I can say it clear and their interactive activities and videos enhance the learning experience. I’m yet to attend an online lesson but hope it will be just as great of an experience as what I’ve had so far.
My enrollment process was simple and easy. I had a lot of questions for Saba who was very prompt and clear with answering then all. I would definitely recommend asking for a demo sample of the VLC as this will give you an experience of what it will be like to have AVADO deliver your course.

headline: Great Avado Review
reviewBody: I was able to join Avado with ease, I find the system easy to use and any queries I had were answered.

headline: Easy and straightforward
reviewBody: Very happy with AVADO.

headline: Easy to enroll
reviewBody: Everything was taking care of promptly and enrolling was very straight-forward! The questions I had were answered quickly and almost everything is taken care of for you - there's only 1 short form to fill out.

headline: I can't wait to get started!
reviewBody:
I can't wait to get started!

Within minutes of confirming we would like to participate in the course, we received a welcome email and throughout the next two days, our accounts have been set up and we have received lots of information.  Everything is particularly efficient and informative.

headline: Excellent

I received sound and informed advice about choosing the right course for me. They have flexibility in payment terms which was helpful for me. The Advisor, Mona was great and very accessible. She always got straight back to me about the numerous inquiries I had when signing up. 
Excellent service all round.

headline: Great overview and detailed explanation...!

We agreed for her to call me back at a certain time which she did and she talked me through all the steps of enrolling whilst on the line and what to expect next. Great initial experience with AVADO.

headline: Excellent virtual learning campus!
reviewBody: I think the layout and structure of the virtual learning campus is the best I have seen - very clear and simple!

headline: Learning is easy with AVADO

I spoke to a representative who gave me good clear information on what was available and what would be best for me.  I start my Diploma in a couple of weeks and I can't wait.

headline: I’m currently on week 2 of the course i…
reviewBody: I’m currently on week 2 of the course i find the experience of using the online tools really easy to follow if i could make suggestion that would improve experience for mobile users would be to be able to watch the recap video takes on mobile device Phones and tablets without having to use flash think this might be a CIPD thing Not AVADO (anyway flash is dead move on) other than that all good

headline: Amazing experience so far
reviewBody: Amazing experience so far, really engaging content and well thought out schedule.

headline: Don't recommend
reviewBody:
Great mentoring, sessions and lessons. PDF and exam resources were useful.

My LDC (Mrs Krutika Patel) was great and let me have meetings face to face and remote and helped me with my projects. She helped explaining the structure of the course and answered any queries i had.

Edit : I finished and completed my apprenticeship at the end of January and still have not received my certificate. 
Edit2: It has been found

headline: Excellent point of contact/ apprentice advisor
reviewBody:
Excellent personal mentoring, study sessions and online lessons. Additional resources that were provided were extremely useful. Flexible enough to allow me to do an additional qualification when I already had the one covered by the course.

10/10 for my apprentice adviser who was able to answer almost any question and provided ample opportunity for study days, face to face meetings and catch up sessions. She helped elucidate the vague and confusing parts of the course criteria and provided examples when she was able. When I had a problem Krutika was the only person I needed to call.

I felt that at times information was slow to make its way to me unless I personally inquired and that there was as much focus on forms and ticking boxes as there was the course content itself. Unsure if this was due to the examining body or avado/ arch however everything was always resolved satisfactorily.

headline: Great study platform
reviewBody: First time trying the online platform for study. I have to say all the staff help me a lot, answers all my question quickly, explain clearly about my study and everything. The course itself easy to understand, Tutor help a lot. If you want to broaden your knowledge but to busy to go out, Avado is your choice.

reviewBody: Had a wonderful time understanding all that was offered and decided to start my learning g journey with Avado

reviewBody: The network was horrible so it was hard for me to fully understand or hear but other than that, I was able to get clear instructions.

headline: Thanks!
reviewBody: Avado’s website had all the information I needed to know, the admissions officer responded to my query timely and made it very easy for me to trust and select Avado for my learning needs. The educational material is in dept and insightful and the student team site is quiet helpful for first time students who are studying online like myself.

headline: Everything was easy

I'm positive in no time I will be able to change my career path and become a professional accountant.

Thanks a lot to the AVADO team!

headline: Avado experience has been great so far…
reviewBody: Avado experience has been great so far I am at the beginning of my journey - however the communication and information has been exceptional - I would highly recommend the provider to others for course content. The customer service provided was exceptional

headline: Making Learning Enjoyable
reviewBody: I've only been studying with AVADO for about a week now, but so far they've been able to guide me in every facet of my learning experience. Their CIPD course is comprehensive and taught in a way that suits all levels of experience. Having been out of university for a few years and worried about studying again, AVADO actually makes learning quite enjoyable.

headline: Advisor with me every step of the way
reviewBody: Could have been complicated, but Georgia from Avado was on the phone with me during the whole enrollment process, including setting up the credit check and direct debit, and talked me through it as I did it. It was completely stress-free.

headline: Simple and easy enrolment process
reviewBody:
To enrol on courses is very simple. Everything is easily explained and all relevant information is given. 

The process is not pushy as they give plenty of time to consider and review options. 

Advisor gave me advice relevant to the path I wanted to pursue. I was very satisfied with the process. 

I would recommend for the ease of enrolment

headline: Prompt and simple registration process
reviewBody: The process to register onto my course was simple and the contact I had with Stuart Young was very useful and prompt. At no point did I not know what was happening. Once loaded onto the course, the login process was straight forward and the site is very user friendly.

I completed my research with a few different providers and then I called to speak to an advisor at AVADO. Leo was knowledgeable and able to answer my questions.

Now looking forward to starting my course

headline: Easy to follow without complexities
reviewBody:
I am really excited to start my learning with Avado.  I had signed up with another provider before now but the course structure looked so complex it was hard and inconsistent to follow and keep motivated about completing the course.  

Avado were very helpful and gave me all the information I needed and the support to help me ensure I am heading in the right direction with my studies.  The online campus is so much easier to follow and make sense of and so far not feeling daunted doing my studies online.  Looking forward to completing my course now. :)

headline: Profssional and efficent

headline: So far so good!

Course materials were sent very quickly after enrolment and the virtual learning campus is laid out clearly and broken down into weekly tasks and reading, which I find a helpful guide to pace me through the course.

reviewBody: I have only just signed up to this company however the customer service I received before I signed up was great and easily contactable. I have received a lot of information for my course in regards to what to expect, all the contact details if I need to ask a question etc.

headline: A fantastic online learning platform
reviewBody: A fantastic online learning platform with a range of support tools to help you complete your qualification in the comfort of your own home. My online tutor was always available to help, the support team reply to emails very quickly and the course content was of a high standard. I'm really proud to achieve my Level 5 HR certificate with AVADO and would recommend 100%

headline: I have not yet started the course.
reviewBody:
I have not yet started the course.
I already feel supported, lets hope I can learn easily and apply new skills.  I am sure I will.

I was confused in regards to the Introducing yourself to your classmates.  This could be easier to find.  I could see no link / list of them anywhere.  I am sure this will be rectified.  I  believe one of my colleagues that did this a few years ago mentioned this also.

headline: Helpful, professional advice
reviewBody:
Recently booked a course having spoken at length with Jay about my options. Jay was knowledgeable and professional and patiently answered my many questions!
The whole process has been easy and quick and I'm excited to start my course.

headline: 5* Rating
reviewBody: Website is easy to access and the advisors are there to help you every step of the way. I had been debating about enrolling for the past year but once I was decided the process was so fast. I was able to make payments and start my career journey through Avado! Thank you

headline: So efficient
reviewBody: I've enrolled on a course through work and it was so easy, I sent an enquiry and got a phone call back straight away where I was told all the information I needed, which was then followed up in an email. The whole process was very easy and straight forward, all of my questions were answered quickly and with all the information I needed. I am very pleased and excited to start my course in the next week! I've managed to set myself up on the online campus as well which all looks very good.

headline: Returning customer!
reviewBody:
I studied HR level 3 with Avado in 2018 and am now back to complete level 5.  

The learning campus was very user friendly, the tutors extremely supportive and the way you can learn in your own time on a variety of devices is great for a full time working mum.

Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Avado!

headline: Comment Based on experience

headline: Fabulous...
reviewBody: Fabulous.... Jonathan Banks took all of the hassle out of my enrolment.

headline: Awful experience-haven't received my…
reviewBody: Awful experience-haven't received my certificate till this day after finishing my course in Jan 2019!!!! Overpriced for what "knowledge" it provides and charging for every single retake of a unit when you paid 2,5k for a certificate! A total rip-off...I have been sent back and forth from AVADO to CIPD to get my certificate for which I worked hard. AVADO should be more responsible in solving complaints between CIPD and the customer and GO AN EXTRA MILE especially when there's such a delay in delivering certificates to people on time.

headline: Excellent from start to finish
reviewBody: I had a excellent start when I enquired about doing my course here, they were quick with emails and calls. Sadly my books took ages to arrive but when I called they were extremely quick to resolve this. The sales lady I spoke to initially was fantastic I know a lot of the questions I had post registration she probably didn't have the answer but she always went above and beyond in order to respond to me. Overall experience has been very fantastic.

headline: Good experience overall
reviewBody: There have been several hiccups during my apprenticeship with AVADO, some of which could not of been prevented. However during this Perran James (My Learning Development Coach) came through with flying colours and really made the whole apprenticeship experience fantastic, as he always provides honest, clear, constructive criticism and was available for any questions I had.

headline: Great way to learn
reviewBody: Great way to learn. Allows you to work at your own pace whilst supporting you to reach deadlines. Tutors are all great and will make time to answer any questions, as well as putting on more sessions if they are needed; so accommodating. Online campus is easy to follow once got used to and would definitely recommend.

headline: Nearing the finish line of my…
reviewBody: Nearing the finish line of my apprenticeship and thought I would leave a quick review about the great service Avado have provided regarding my apprenticeship and in particular my learning coach Perran James. Despite being extremely busy Perran always went above and beyond to help me with my apprenticeship and answer and concerns or queries I had. I wouldn't of got this far without him. I would recommend Avado as an apprenticeship provider, as although there were a few hiccups getting started with the apprenticeship these were sorted out quickly and efficiently and there was a clear plan regarding what I would need to do to complete my apprenticeship and the stages I would move to in order to do so.

headline: My Phone Encounter:
reviewBody:
I made some enquiries recently on how to move forward and take on the HR CIPD courses which, had been on my mind for years.
A lady via the phone line - I wouldn’t mention her name (she knows herself) was very helpful. 
Again, I was thrilled on how my questions were answered in the most polite way. And anytime I needed more information she was there. It didn’t matter how many questions I had asked this lady she simply answered them to the best of her abilities. Initially I thought there were free courses run by the government schemes. I got encouraged and am enrolled to begin my HR CIPD online courses from next year 2020.
Thank you ever so much for being kind and transparent. 
Keep up the good efforts and that’s why I have given this review my first (five stars)..

headline: Good choice for CIPD
reviewBody:
Helpful tutors, good learning platform & sessions
Switched to a new learning platform for last unit and I don't think it was quite ready to be used with a few errors/issues but looked good besides that.
Only downside is you can't progress at your own speed so once you've completed your assessment you have to wait for the next unit to open. When it says it usually takes up to 12/18/etc months to complete that is the minimum time not the average.

headline: The course is brilliant
reviewBody: The course is brilliant, starting my second unit and getting all those answers I was looking for to become an HR professional.

headline: Horrible experience
reviewBody:
Through AVADO, I completed my CIPD LvL 5 in Learning and Development. The course and tutoring were not of the highest standard, but were functional in helping to complete the requirements of the program.

However I have had signficant difficulties with AVADO following the completion of my qualification. In June of this year (2019) I completed my final module of the course and naturally assumed that this would result in my certification being processed in due order. I am now currently in the onboarding process for a new role that requires my certification and have found out that AVADO had failed to submit my details to CiPD until November, a full 5 months after completion. This will now likely result in a delay to my start date and financial difficulties because I am unable to start my job. AVADO's customer support teams are extremely difficult to get responses from.

This has ended in being a horrible experience with this group and a cause of immense stress on myself

headline: I had shopped around all distance…
reviewBody:
I had shopped around all distance learning courses in regards to HR CIPD Level 5 with the following in mind:
1. Flexible learning,
2. To be able to finish one unit and move straight on to the next without having to wait. 
3. Honesty and Transparency

I was told Avado do all of the above and paid in full and signed up. It was only on the first day when their systems went down that I called up and asked how long they would be down that I was told I had to wait for it to come back online which wasn't an issue but they made a slight joke about me needing to get used to the waiting of system as this is what I would have to do between units. When I questioned this I was told I would have to wait 6-8 weeks on some units until I could progress. This was certainly not my plan nor explained to me. I expressed to the dept manager I felt like I was mis-sold the course and cancelled down my agreement. I cant fault the support team r.e. cancellation and refund but it does need to be vocalised at point of interest you cannot go through course at a quicker pace should you wish to do so.  
I cant comment on system as I didn't get that far.

headline: Does not meet expectations
reviewBody:
Honestly, Avado is the cheapest option for online study therefore I have had to join however I find both the customer service and tutor support severely lacking.Although I have raised this with them, it takes them days to reply to the smallest of queries. 
Their sign up team is good and willing to go out of their way however this is where the service ends. 
The online platform is good however they do not allow you to study at your own pace as lessons are restricted to weeks. I found this be true despite requesting the weeks to be opened,

headline: AVADO provides Quality Online Learning.
reviewBody: AVADO provides Quality Online Learning. It’s Staff are friendly, easy to talk to and very Accommodating. Also been informed I should be able to see things on my notice board by my tutor, yet nothing is showing. 
Worryingly hearing the same from other students.

headline: £700+ for nothing but textbooks
reviewBody: I personally feel like I have been conned into buying 5 textbooks for £700. I find the virtual classes are disengaging, vague and not suited to me. The textbooks are poorly written, don't make much sense most of the time and have so many grammatical errors in the making reading the them fairly difficult to understand. Over the phone when I was enquiring about my course, the salesman had said the exams were cheaper than the actually are and completely failed to mention the membership to AAT was not included and that I would have to pay another £90 on top of everything else. I truly don't feel as this is worth the money I have paid to teach myself.

headline: AVOID AVADO
reviewBody:
If I could select zero stars I would. I have started the courses two years ago- level 3&4- before giving birth. After having the baby I’ve just realised that is completely impossible for me to continue studying as I needed to be present in my baby’s  life 100%. So i have called Avado explaining the situation and they just remained neutral saying I will lose my money if I will not continue with them. I have paid over £3000 for these courses and I can’t finish them. I have started studying level 3 online but I wasn't happy with the resources: no online classes available, no mock exams other than the once on AAT website and that took me extra time to study, time that I couldn’t spend learning for myself. I don't want to continue level 3& 4 with Avado and I asked for a refund but has been refused. 

I feel really disappointed and would like to warn other students. DO NOT USE AVADO! AVOID!!!

I will start write about Avado on all websites I know just for people to be informed and stay away!

headline: 5 Stars! You won't be disappointed!
reviewBody:
My experience enrolling with Avado was brilliant.

Nik C couldn't have done any more for me, honestly, he was so helpful and friendly and went out of his way to answer my queries. He's been a star for MONTHS helping me out! Thank you so much Nik!

I also think the price for CIPD L3 Diploma was amazing! It was discounted for September so I enrolled for January 2020 and saved over £600! That's HUGE for a single mother and will make such a difference to us! So thank you, Avado!

Avado also give you a 12 month NUS card for free. Every little helps :)

I can't wait until my start date and to see the online campus etc!

Thank you so much Avado and Nik!

headline: Avado is simply a 5 star service all around.
reviewBody:
Avado is simply a 5 star service all around. I have been in communication with Avado for around 6 months with an interest in starting an AAT accounting course. Having never worked in an accounting environment I discussed with the Avado representative Jonathan what my background was, what level I felt I may be comfortable learning towards and my personal ambitions and potential barriers. 
Jonathan described the course and all of its features and the support I would receive throughout. The information provided on the day was enough for me to feel confident to sign up to the course and when the time was right i dealt with the financial and induction process with Jonathan to enrol. The enrolment took half an hour and I am pleased and looking forward to the steps I am now able to take towards a new career.

headline: Avado - refund refusal
reviewBody:
I have purchased AAT level 3 and level 4 in September 2018 as a bulk course. I managed to finish level 3 on my own pace, as my group was going a little bit too slow for me. When I asked about being moved to the earlier group I was told to pay extra £100, for studying faster than my own group. I would understand if I wasn't keeping up with my group :(

I haven't started level 4 yet nor got any materials. I wasn't happy with the resources for synoptic level 3 exam: no online classes available, no mock exams other than the once on AAT website. I don't want to continue level 4 with Avado and I asked for a partial refund but it has been refused. 

I feel really disappointed and would like to warn other students. Think twice before buying more than one level, cause it is better to be safe than sorry :(

headline: Quick response, friendly service and easy to use!
reviewBody: Thanks Habiba for getting in touch after I made an initial enquiry.  I was contacted first thing the following morning by phone with a follow up email. On returning her call, she was very pleasant, knowledgable in her field and patient. Nothing was too much trouble and she was perceptive in helping decide which level of the course would be right for me. Payment options were easy and quick and the relevant material came through straight away.  I've now had a really good look at how the course works on the visual learning system and cannot wait to get started. From what I have seen and experienced so far, the course looks easy to follow, has plenty of support if you need it and forums to chat to your peers. I would have no hesitation in recommending Avado so far.

headline: Best decision I’ve made
reviewBody: Hoses fly the best decision I’ve ever made , learning platform so easy to use and the support and guidance is second to non

headline: Honor Holloway - BEST TUTOR EVER - VLC great experience
reviewBody:
It was a great experience to learn through the VLC and Avado, they make it so easy to digest and provide so much advise and help that you do not miss a regular F2F class at all! In fact, you choose when you can study and it is a lot easier to organise yourself. 

But what really made my learning experience was my tutor Honor Holloway. She was extremely supportive, making time for me when I needed it and always helping a lot! Her tutor support sessions were just brilliant, going, point by point, on all assessment requirements and making sure all of us were aware of what we needed to do and that we were comfortable with what was needed to meet and exceed the requirements so we could do a great job, always keeping the nice vibe and happy tone, and motivating us at all times. 
On a personal note, I had difficulties on a family level and Honor has always been there giving me the extra support and the understanding I needed twice over the course, especially coping with loss whilst trying to meet the assessment deadlines, juggling also with work, etc. She is a BRILLIANT person as well as an AWESOME tutor, and she is the 99% of those 5 stars of this review. If you get lucky enough to have Honor as your tutor, be sure YOU WILL LEARN SO MUCH, YOU WILL GET THE SUPPORT YOU MAY NEED, AND YOU WILL ENJOY THE PATH ALONG THE WAY. 
Thank you so much for this amazing experience learning with you, Honor! All the best!

headline: Best ACCA learning provider
reviewBody:
AVADO, definitely! From the 3 learning providers that I had contacted, AVADO, in the person of Allison Moore, was the only one who gave the information I needed, without any complication.
After my enrollment, I had one problem with my learning platform, that after my report it was immediately sorted.
Allison is just awesome!

headline: I have been encouraged by Stuart for…
reviewBody: I have been encouraged by Stuart for over a year now to enroll on the Level 3 AAT course. When I explained more than once I could not start the course due to personally circumstances Stuart was polite and patient.  He would send an email or phone once every few months no hounding like some companies do.   When I eventually had the opportunity to start  Stuart guided me through the process.  The staff were friendly polite and patient in helping me to enrol.  I have been a bit hesitate in enrolling on a distance learning course however with a bit of research I decided this was the best option for me due to my hours of work.  The enrollment process was a lot easier than I thought and the staff got back to me the same day.  Thats all I got to think about now is to get through my course and exams.  Thank you Stuart for all your help!

headline: Reviews not fully indicative of service
reviewBody: So, I see there has been a LOT of great reviews of late for Avado! My suggestion would be when looking here that you go straight to the 1 and 2 star section which are quite recent yet overtaken by these 'new' reviews. The wonderful new reviews also cover the sales pitch and booking, not the real experience of no support, sudden cut off dates for studying even though you've paid in full. They also don't cover the facts that Avado can change the service provision anytime they see fit apparently without giving the right to receive a refund for change of contract. I can't even book an exam anymore in my home town, they expect me to do a 50 mile round trip for every exam i take now, which is not what i signed up for. £2k out of pocket with decisions to make...

headline: The AVADO CIPD Intermediate Certificate in Learning and Development is very poor value for money
reviewBody:
Having recently completed the AVADO CIPD Intermediate Certificate in Learning and Development, I believe the course is very poor value for money, because:
 
•	Lack of academic rigour – Much of the set / recommended content was very limited in depth / detail and often based on poor quality, unreliable sources. Peer-reviewed, academic / professional sources were provided during the course, but not consistently. Overall, input was limited in quantity and of poor quality. 

•	Poorly written course materials – Instructions were sometimes incoherent / not clearly articulated / missing.  There were at times very noticeable, basic grammar / spelling / punctuation mistakes. 

•	Basic, not very professionally constructed online learning platform – The online platform was adequate for the needs of the course, though there were obvious flaws, e.g. repeated (perhaps through inattentive copying and pasting) and missing sections (where a link would not work / lead to a nothing). The presentation of the in-house produced materials, including print and video content, was noticeably basic with at times obvious errors and inconsistencies. This point and the last were particularly surprising / disappointing / irritating, when one considers the cost of the course (see below). 

•	Limited response to participants’ outputs – Online discussion forums / tasks were set up on the online learning platform but for significant durations of the course, there was no feedback from the course tutor(s) on the participants’ contributions. Consequently, although participants did share experiences, opinions, ideas and resources (though their engagement appeared to drop as the course progressed), opportunities to signpost and build on this output were often neglected, i.e. without any response, or superficial. 

•	Poor coordination / communication – Basic / important course information, e.g. dates for webinars, was sometimes incorrect / not clearly articulated / not provided in a timely manner to course participants. 

•	Lack of / misleading information about cost of certificate – After payment for and the start of the course, participants were encouraged to become members of the CIPD and informed they had to be members in order to get the official CIPD certificate upon completion. The cost of this membership was £135 and it expired on the last day of the course. After the end of the course, participants were again informed they had to be members of the CIPD to get the official CIPD certificate, i.e. they had to pay again to get it, even if they were not interested in being a member of the CIPD any more (like me). The cost to renew the membership was £98. Either this information was not communicated to participants before the start of the course or it was not done so clearly enough. In the end, I decided not to buy the official CIPD certificate, because of my disappointment when I found out I was, in fact, not going to be issued with it unless I paid even more money, and because of my overall dissatisfaction with the course. 

When I consider overall these issues of quality, substance and clarity, along with the relatively very high cost of this course (£3,595) and that of other, similar study experiences I have completed, this is why I believe the AVADO CIPD Intermediate Certificate in Learning and Development is very poor value for money.

I was unaware that AVADO were going to be reaching out to me over the phone when I made an enquiry through CIPD and that is the only part of the process that I would recommend mending - having a bit more clarity on which company will reach out to you and the fact it will be over the phone. headline: Very good learning experience with Avado
reviewBody:
Very good learning experience with great structure, helpful and intuitive VLC and extremely supportive tutors. 

Only negative is perhaps they should do a few more lecturers to reduce the ratio of reading to teaching. For people like myself, I learn a lot more from demonstration and illustration as oppose to simpy reading text.

One other slight negative is that the text pulled from text books for the online readkn is occasionally strangely ordered and I feel certain bits should be moved around to provide a more coherent/lineal learning path with reading.

It all makes sense in the end but you do find yourself going back to read some more complicated bits once you encounter the fundamental basics of it later on.

headline: Teaching Teachers to Teach Teachers
reviewBody:
I was entirely new to HR and L&D, despite being a teacher for 20 years when I enrolled. I had delivered teacher training CPD sessions, but this course was an eye opener into the 'real world' of diagnosing needs, designing solutions, managing progress, and evaluating their success. I have found the content highly relevant, and the assessments made me think about my learning.

The case studies and reports were fascinating. I work in a completely different environment to the private sector. I originally started the course with the intention of leaving teaching, but the course has rekindled my love for what I do. It has helped me to get a new teaching job, as I was able to talk about elements of the course in my interview.

I know where I want my role to go and this course has helped me take those first steps.

My tutor, Joanna, was brilliant. She calmly responded to my many emails, and I felt like my contributions to webinars were valued. The webinars are excellent and very active, supporting the structured weekly activities. 

It's hard to study after work, but I actually ended up wanting to learn more about L&D. I feel like I've got a level of expertise in this that I can share. So, yes, it's not easy to shuffle your life. At times, something will have to give (in my case it was running, but I was injured anyway), but I think it's worth it. I've regained some lost confidence. I've found my way. And the support you get will help you to succeed.

headline: Avado Experience
reviewBody:
Learning the level 3 CIPD HR practice through Avado has been a joy over the 9 month period. The format of weekly learning per unit, leading up to the assessment, allows students to find their best routine and ease into that comfortably and quickly - particularly if working full-time or having other commitments i.e. family. The regular knowledge testing and sharing of viewpoints among fellow students was particularly beneficial and helped a great deal in shaping ideas when serious thought and dedication was applied towards the assessment. The tutors were also fantastic, thoroughly supportive and positive, and I found their feedback for the assessments to be excellent. 
I would recommend Avado to anyone!

headline: Friendly and straightforward
reviewBody: The process was very straightforward and everything was explained to me with no pressure to join. They were happy to let me look over the details and offered to call me back in a few weeks, but they didn't need to as they were by far the best company I spoke to. Everything was done over the phone and I had access to my course in less than 1 hour. I can't wait for my course to officially start.

headline: Happy to sign up!
reviewBody: Nik, the gent I dealt with, was phenomenal. He was incredibly easy to talk to, open, honest, a brilliant response rate and so knowledgeable. His eagerness to help and answer my questions made it possible for me to know 110% I was making the right decision. The only point I would make is to not concentrate so hard on the best sale, it’s obvious and detracts from the overall experience. I understand commission and targets, but it has to be about the students best interests, not the monthly figures.

headline: A great learning provider
reviewBody: Completed both my level 2 AAT accounting course and my level 3 in the same field. Can't fault anything about Avado. They offer weekly live lessons so that people who feel they learn better being taught by someone are catered for, however if you are confident to go at your own pace then you can skip ahead and work through each week at your leisure. Books arrive within a week of signing up for the course and the website offers plenty of mock exams, weekly learning opportunities and forums to discuss topics with other Avado members. Can't recommend highly enough.

headline: Astonishingly poor service, saved from a 1* review only by their easy online system
reviewBody:
I enrolled for the AAT2 accountancy certificate in July 2018. I received the books, and all of them were littered with errors - some grammatical and (to a degree) excusable, some with errors in the sequence of steps taken to arrive at the solution to a problem, and incorrect entry amounts. Avado are supposedly in the business of steering students away from such accounting errors.

I took it upon myself to suggest corrections, with a couple of "thank yous", no apology on the first few occasions until I pressed the point of paying nearly £1000 for dreadfully edited course materials. 

At one point I received "yes, you are correct Alex, well done". I didn't want recognition or condescension, I wanted accuracy in the first place. I asked them to reissue the texts with errors corrected. They said "yes, certainly", but nothing materialised.

If I were in their position, I'd be tripping over myself with an apology, and assurance of future corrections and an offer of a refund. I had to ask for one. They did not address it at all.

Thankfully, I didn't struggle with the concepts offered by this course. Avado must awaken themselves to the reality that there are some people who might struggle, and a single mis-placed word here or there could make all the difference to their level of understanding. Nothing was done, despite the clarity with which I expressed the need for this. 

I'm currently awaiting the result of my accounting software exam, which will be abysmal, as I was tested using a software I'd never seen before. Avado provided a redundant form of it, and no assessment centres offered tests using it, so I was reduced to learning (to me) a completely new software within the confines of an exam. I'd never run out of time in an exam until this point.

I didn't use the tutors at all. I just hoped or expected the course materials to be accurate and usable, far less to do their editing job for them (and see no positive result for myself of the rest of my cohort).

All details of the course I completed, and practice assessments I took, have vanished from my online dashboard. Thankfully it's not pivotal, and is honestly in line with the way they seem to treat their students. Just spit them out at the end.

It baffles me that in a profession where detail is key, there was such a staggering range and quantity of errors in the material, which were occasionally even ruinous to the ideas put forward.

The grammar, one might argue, is unimportant, but it reflects poorly on Avado as an official seat of learning to have committed such basic mistakes.

I don't think I hold my educational history to a higher standard than I should. You HAVE to be right on the money with course material, among other things, otherwise your reputation will suffer. I wouldn't normally do this, but I'm now in the business of outing them on review sites, so uninterested was their stance on things, in the hope that prospective students choose another provider and don't fall foul of similar maltreatment.

Atrocious customer service. They were just happy to take my money and do nothing to resolve my issues. For a subject in which accuracy is paramount, I found their attitude towards all of the above, and towards their own reputation, utterly dumbfounding.

In short, I won't use Avado again, and hope others don't either.

headline: A course shaped around you.
reviewBody: I study for the level 5 L&D Diploma with Avado. I have been working and studying for the past eight months. I was a bit skeptical of doing such an important course online at first. It turns out instead that it is one of the best courses I have ever done. I saw comments from students complaining about the technical side of the platform. The point is that technology unfortunately sometimes can be a bit of a pain. So far for me though, anytime there was something unexpected, Avado has always fixed it quickly. I enjoy my course a lot. Even though sometimes it is had to combine work, studies and personal life, you always have your tutor support for any help, as well as your peers. The course is vary and not boring at all. It is absolutely engaging and live classes are great. For anyone who is considering to start with Avado, stop doubting and just do it!

headline: No support, do not trust these people
reviewBody:
I started an AAT level 3/4 course which was a total of 3 years to complete in February 2018, I paid for the course, and had no support from the start, I spent several months trying to get help and eventually gave up, I have just applied through a better recommended school of study, and I have had to save hard to pay for this again. I am taking legal advise as I want my money back.
Do not go with these people there is no support.

headline: CIPD Level 3 Diploma
reviewBody: The process was easy and simple to complete. I had a pre-arranged phone call to discuss my learning options and course details which helped me to decide if the course was for me. I have been out of education for over 20 years and I was anxious about how well I could adapt and balance work/home and the course. The call handler was informative and friendly and put me at ease right away. I can't wait to begin my learning journey in July!

headline: Not terrible, but there could be major improvements
reviewBody:
I am a current student of Avado studying the CIPD diploma. Although their platform looks professional and is easy to use, the content is less than desirable. A few typos and the assessment instructions are often unclear or misleading. The tutorials do not provide much more than the content you find online. The tutors also take a long time to reply to queries (although this, I am sure, is dependent on the tutor you are given).

Avado were the more expensive option compared to my local classroom-based courses, and because of the above issues, I do not feel the price is a true reflection of the quality of the product offered. However, I do enjoy the remote nature of the course. Working full time means I cannot attend classes, therefore this fits in with my lifestyle.

reviewBody: Works really well if you are a student from Europe or the US. Asia Pacific students find themselves up against awkward timings for group works as most of their peers are from Europe and US.

headline: I have been studying with AVADO for…
reviewBody:
I have been studying with AVADO for nearly a month now, the AAT Level 2 course.  So far, I am finding the course work (textbooks, online content, quizzes ) - all really easy to follow and cleverly constructed.  However, there are some grammar mistakes in their book work. That might seem ridiculous to comment on, but it really drives me crazy when a profesional educator hasn’t checked their work enough to notice... we are paying them money to educate us after all (and I’m no grammar whiz myself)!  The other reason I am only giving 3 stars is because I expected the course to be way more personal... I have been studying for nearly a month and haven’t had any one personally contact me to make sure I have everything I need/am getting on okay... I am doing the course faster then their laid out plan... meaning the forums that the tutor starts are irrelevant to me, and so are the live classes (you can watch recordings of past live classes but that doesn’t help if you have a question).

All in all, I’m still happy that I have chosen to study with them, as I think I’m still probably learning better with their interactive online content then I would if I was just self pace studying with AAT textbooks.  But thought I would write an honest review to help readers understand what they get.

Over the course I began to become more confident and enjoyed.  I would recommend to anyone.

headline: CIPD Level 5 certificate
reviewBody: Was really nervous about online learning initially as I’m an older student and not entirely tech savvy! The course was run well, always knew what was required, plenty of support to help you through the assignments  and my tutor Loretta McKay was always on hand if I needed anything and always responded to queries quickly.  Once I settled in to the process, it was easy to get through and ended up really enjoying it. Would recommend.

headline: stay away!
reviewBody: There are certain things you need to know before embarking on a course with these people. There are hidden costs. They don’t tell you that you will have to pay a fee (about £100) to become CIPD registered. The course is twice the price of doing it at a regular college. You can’t complete the course entirely on your own, you will need to enlist the help of either colleagues or family and friends. The subject matter is so simple, it should really be a multiple choice exam. But they insist on very lengthy and elaborate assignments which to all intents and purposes may as well be a dissertation. Stay away! If you want a CIPD qualification, go to a college in the evening or go through your work.

headline: Start date confusion
reviewBody:
There was some confusion around my start date- I was told I would start in July because all the places were taken however, I was placed on the June course. I was obviously happy with that change but I was not made aware until I got an email from my tutor informing me of a lesson she was teaching for the June class. 

I have also not received my books yet, however that may just be because I was late to the course and they're on there way. It has only been a week since I enrolled.

Other than those issues everything has been perfect!

headline: Really straight forward
reviewBody:
Really straight forward 

The enrolment process was made so easy, and having had time to look through the online dashboard, I am really excited to get under way with my learning. Love the progress bar on the top, along with the calendar highlighting key dates for assessments, when study should be completed, along with the time frames given.

Clearly a professional business with lots of experience getting it right.

headline: Perfect for distance learning!
reviewBody: Perfect if you want to study distance learning, classes and materials are there at the click of a button. But equally if you want to teach yourself you are left to your own devices. All tutors are available when you need them too. I have done my previous AAT levels with Avado and wouldn't consider studying with anyone else. The online campus is fantastic and such a modern way to study. Working full time with a little one and not having to go to evening or weekend classes is a real bonus!

headline: So much patience and a really great experience so far!
reviewBody:
It was really great to be in touch with Andrew who was really patient with my and my enrollment. I was interested in this program already for several months but due to heavy workload in my job I wasn’t able to register immediately. Andrew kept in touch regularly to share new starting dates and finally now I am ready to start this new experience in July 2019. 
Once i was able to confirm my starting date the registration and payment e-mail were easy to follow. Again Andrew had to be patient with me as I was traveling a lot in that period and couldn’t really follow up with my emails. 

I am looking forward to start this new adventure mostly online. this will be already a great learning school as with my company we are also looking into bringing more training online.very curious how I will evolve ...

headline: AVOID!!
reviewBody: AVOID!!! I called them as I wanted to start AAT level 2. The sales person was pushy and told me I'd save money if I buy all 3 levels. I was under the impression these would be 3 separate orders, and the cancellation period would apply for each level. My circumstances have now changed, and I'm going to struggle doing levels 3 and 4 within the timeframe given. I've tried to contact them to get help, but now they have my money, they don't care at all. I'm so disappointed, and wish I'd read the reviews before parting with nearly £3,000 for a course that isn't flexible in the slightest. Not happy. Will be taking this further.

headline: Absolutely horrendous experienc
reviewBody:
Horrendous experience from the start.

I would not recommend studying with Avado. I was sold this course on the pretense it would be very flexible, I work full time for the ambulance service meaning my hours are not structured and also incurring long over runs, not finishing on time and unable to maintain a structured studying time frame. There have been a multitude of errors been made by the provider. There are lots of grammatical and numerical errors in the books. The online tests sometimes have the wrong answers even though you have answered correctly (confirmed by my tutor that my answer is correct and the system is wrong). I turned up to one exam and the exam center had moved to another town, I was not informed of this. When I complained I was told I was sent an email, I thoroughly checked through all my emails, inbox, junk, trash etc - this email was no where to be found. I turned up to another exam and the exam had not been booked with the exam center, luckily they had a space and let me sit my exam. I turned up to another exam and they had not paid for my exam therefore I had to wait until the exam center had spoken to Avado who confirmed they would pay for it. 

Now I have one more exam remaining and due to my full time full on work commitments I have been unable to study. I rang avado to find out how long I would have access to the online platform, they advised it would expire at the end of July and if I wanted to access it after that it would be around £45 per month (even though I paid upfront for my studying and my last exam had not yet been sat). I do not understand why this fee is so high. This is not the flexible studying I was promised. I was informed on the phone that I was told at the time of my purchase the online studying would expire, this is not true. I have nothing in writing to confirm there would be an end date to my course.

My 3rd year will absolutely not be with this company and I would urge others to explore other options before committing to this study. I know others feel the same from talking to my peers on the course and speaking with people prior to going into exams, they have all experienced the same issues. 

This is not a good enough service for the money paid.

headline: Stay away!!!
reviewBody: The only good thing abou them is the enrollment process. They nice and everything goes smooth. And that the only good thing about it. I have started my Level 4 Accountancy with them and due to personal and health circumstances, I could not take all the exams straight away. After some time I have contacted them and I have been told that, because I have paid for mu course in full, I can still sit my exams. That was in 2017. I was not given any deadline for it nor time scale. I have contacted them recey and they told me that because the qualifications has changed I have to pay for my own exams now!!!! They were included in the fee that I have paid for!!! I can understand that certain things i qualifications has changed but that does not affect the principle of Accounatncy!!!! Its not like the whole thing had been scraped and the re-write again!!!! They do not have any consideration for student personal circumstances whatsoever!!!! The reason why people want home learning its because they want to study in their own time!!! When I first enroll, the time limit was only on VCL and tutor support. Not on exams!!!! I have requested money back from them to cover the exams. If I will not receive it, Ill be taking them to court!!!!! I am a single parent and chances finding again that kind of money is next to nothing!!! They are senseless and selfish money grabbing people!!!

headline: Thanks AVADO and Loretta!
reviewBody:
I have recently completed my CIPD Level 5 under the guidance of Avado and Loretta McKay. 

I was extremely nervous about starting the course as I had been away from studying for over 10 years. The first couple of months were difficult to fit everything in to an already busy life however now that it is completed it is one of the best things I have done. 

Loretta was an amazing tutor and the support and guidance she provided was second to none. I asked a lot of questions and was always on hand to provide reassurance. 

I am now off to study for the Diploma which is an additional 4 months. :) 

I will definitely recommend Avado for anyone who is looking to do their CIPD in the future.

headline: AVOID BY ALL COSTS!!!
reviewBody:
This is the THE WORST experience in my entirely life with a studies.
It's first started with a lovely lady on the phone promising how incredible was the course and basically "selling" it to me. I was sure this will be the best customer service support as the lady was so informative and attentive. The lady on the phone was called Barbara, and I wish she NEVER called me in my life now...But as long as I applied for the course it turned out to be completely opposite!
I started my HR level 3 course in September, as I'm full time working and I left university as I really struggled with money but wanted to get a good qualification I thought AVADO will be the best option how wrong I was...The course structure looked interesting and I was sure the tutor and lessons will be as good. But the course turned out to be VERY poor and tutors were...well, just unhelpful I would say at least. I was told I can't cancel my contract, but I would do that in October with a big pleasure, so I was still FORCED to pay huge amount of money, even thought I explained I am physically struggling to do so. As their manager still couldn't agree with cancelling my contract I thought of changing course to Digital Marketing, hoping it will be better structured and more useful. But was mistaken again. You are not even getting a professional qualification which can be recognised. Is more like of "coursera" course but costs a lot of money. I was basically in situation, where I have no choice but keep study, as money will be taken from my account anyway. So I switch back to HR course to start "from scratch" it was a new tutor and everything was promising to be better. My course started in January and I also had to pay extra £150 or so, because I had to "re-do it" all over again...So my digital classroom was with a lot of bags and I had no access to full studies and couldn't get in touch for  my tutor or anyone at all. Student services were replying once or two per week with something like "someone will be in touch with you shortly" so I end up with failing my first assignment deadline as when they kind of fixed my classroom, I couldn't catch up with ALL of the material I missed to quickly. Now I have no idea what am I supposed to do... I feel like crying and screaming as I am in a very difficult finance situation and since September I gained ZERO knowledge of support, I only paid £2,5k for NOTHING. Completely to the air...I wish someone to cancel this hell of the contract I had to sign and fully refund me all the money I paid for THE NONSENSE....Looks like I need to find a lawyer with this case,as I have a full right too get a refund, when I gate NO service at all. EVERYTHING they promised was THE SCUM... first time in my life I was fooled and disappointed like that...

headline: DO NOT USE!!!!
reviewBody:
1. SAVE YOUR MONEY - Firstly the course cost £1000 more than any other in the market for the same level of education if not worse. 

2. TUTOR KNEW NOTHING ABOUT THE COURSE - The tutor taught the class little to nothing and we even forced to form a Watsapp group for supporting each other which was all the student on the course, all 40+ constantly remarking how terrible the tutor was at teaching.

3. TUTOR WAS RUDE - The tutor would say rude and dismissive comments and would favor certain students particular students of a certain gender. Additonally although the cost of the course was £3000 several people decided to leave based on how our tutor acted. 

4. INCORRECT COURSE MATERIAL - The course would often provide guidelines that were needed to complete assignments for the course then assessors would fail the assignment for using their guidelines.

5. NO CERTIFICATE - After completing the course, they delayed issuing the entire classes certificates for 3-6 months due to being poor planning and even cost some of my classmate's promotions/jobs.

Overall they are the worst company I have ever experience for any qualification in the market.

DO NOT USE.

headline: Best decision I've made in a decade...
reviewBody:
I was apprehensive about distance learning and thought I would struggle not being in a traditional learning environment however, I found the course to be full of really effective learning methods and the tutor support was fantastic. Although the course was a lot of hard work, I still managed to fit it in with a 50 hour a week job and two young kids due the well structured course map, I knew where I was up to and exactly what I needed to do at all times tracking my progress as I went. 

For me, this course has helped facilitate a career change and I'm now in a job I love and my future career looks bright, thanks Avado!

headline: Reach the stars with Avado!
reviewBody:
I have not undertaken any formal adult education since 2006 and due to commitments I could not afford the time to attend college so was unsure how I would fair by not only undertaking this course but also doing it through distance learning.
Well, Avado made it easy, from enrollment through to course completion, it was seamless. The hardest part was getting used to studying again, but the tutor is always there for you and the scheduled tutor support sessions are excellent. In fact if you participate in the sessions and also pay attention to the week in action videos then you really have no reason not to achieve they are excellent handrails to support your learning journey. 
Without doubt I would turn to Avado as my learning solution in the future, I am confident that with the package they offer I can achieve even more.

headline: Never to old to Learn

Avado give you a great learning environment that's conducive to producing successful assessments, building Skills and knowledge week on week, I for one will definitely be back for my next qualification.  Great people and a great learning experience. It's never to late to learn something new and meet some amazing people along the way. Yes, i would do it all again.

Bare in mind the cost of the course is more than £3000... Disgusting. Unless you are dead or have a medical situation you can not ask for a discount. They leave it to last minute so you have to pay or not get the certification. Please, please be very careful. Find another course provider. I will never recommend AVADO. Disgusting.

headline: Back in stride again!
reviewBody:
I previously studied manual and computerised bookkeeping 6 years ago, at an Adult College, with City & Guilds qualifications under my belt.  It was a struggle to gain even voluntary, never mind working experience as I have none.  Therefore I gave up trying.  

I am ready to try again but with AAT which is THE qualification to have under your belt.  I registered with AVADO Learning and from the start my experience is 100% positive.

I spoke with a lovely colleague called Solomon who, not only talked me through the whole process but actually listened to what I had to say of my experience in the past.  He also provided learning tips and the way forward when applying for vacancies in this field.

He identified that I could start at AAT Foundation Certificate in Accounting, which I have already begun studying and thoroughly enjoying it.  I am truly grateful to Solomon as I know this time round I will succeed!

headline: Just signed up to foundation…
reviewBody:
Just signed up to foundation certificate in accounting and my advisor Jonathon Banks was brilliant. Extremely knowledgeable and helpful giving me different options and respecting the fact I had done my research and had a plan of what I wanted to do. Very patient with me when I needed time to mull the options over and clear communication throughout. 

Excited to started the course.

headline: CIPD Level 5 certificate In HR
reviewBody:
It had been 30 years since I had embarked on any academic learning and was very nervous about how I would cope with the CIPD Level 5 on-line course, having only had face to face lectures etc before. I needn't have worried. The design of the course material is very easy to use and I soon became comfortable with it and found out how not to end up  'going down wormholes' of endless links to more and more information.
The accessibility of support and guidance from the student support team is excellent and I cannot give enough praise to our course tutor Loretta Mckay, who gave clarity, excellent guidance, support , encouragement and advice to all queries and questions, knowing the course content inside and out.
There were a few teething problems with the web site now and again but these were addressed quickly.
One word of warning , do not underestimate the amount of work and time needed for the course (about 10-15 hours a week). I work two days and found it manageable but know some of my full time colleagues struggled but managed. Nevertheless, the content is interesting, relevant and left me hungry for more. Well worth the investment in all ways.

headline: Very satisfied with the level of care…
reviewBody:
Very satisfied with the level of care provided by Cheryl Ball, my customer service rep. She understood my requirements, provided advice and guided me through the registration process. There was a slight issue with payment authorization but Ms. Ball and the customer service staff were very supportive and we got the issue resolved as soon as possible.

The virtual learning environment looks very user friendly as well, and I look forward to utilizing it.

headline: I am currently studying for the CIPD Level 5 Human Resource Management Diploma
reviewBody:
I am currently studying for the CIPD Level 5 Human Resource Management diploma. I was nervous about using an online provider, particularly at this level. My last study was 30+ years ago and I was anxious about not have a face to face tutor or 'classroom'.  
However, Avado are especially good at helping you when you are stuck. I have a dedicated tutor (Honor Holloway) who is very good at responding to my urgent pleas for assistance when I am stuck, which for me are usually late at night. She has often called me the next day. It is very helpful to discuss the course and assignments with her to make sure I am on the right track and she gives me real support, helping me work through any problems myself so I fully understand what the assignments are requiring and empowering me. There are also students discussion forums where we help support each other if confused. Avado also offers real-time tutor+Group sessions which are incredibly helpful and the online campus is really easy to navigate. 
My only concern is the amount of time I need to study. I work full time and was told I'd need around 8 hours a week study. This is actually more like double that which is hard with a full time job and 3 kids.  I have put my social life on hold for a year and have a very understanding husband!  Having said all that, it's a great way to get a proper qualification whilst still working full time. I am a perfectionist and perhaps I do spend too much time studying but I have a thirst for success and fear of failure which keeps me driven. I would recommend Avado to study a CIPD qualification for anyone that is working full time and doesn't have the money or time to be able to go back to uni or college. Avado are completely up to date on all current HR thinking and have extremely strong links with the CIPD. The content is very relevant and incredibly interesting and the finance options are very affordable, with easy monthly payments spread over 12 - 36 or more months.

My log in details came through within minutes and I've been able to explore both on my phone and laptop with no issues. I had a bad experience with another online training provider and so far Avado have trumped this - I can't wait to start!

The advisor Shaz then offered to call me & we talked through the whole process, how it works, finance options & any more questions I had. I was emailed details of the course & given time to think it over. I appreciated Shaz not being pushy or too sales driven. I emailed with a few more questions & the response turnaround time was amazing. The actual enrolment was really easy & all done on my phone. I had no reservation or hesitation in joining the course with Avado.

headline: Rather disappointing at the moment - lets hope it improves!
reviewBody:
So far my experience with Avado has been mediocre, and is swiftly becoming very disappointing. When you have been promised 12 months free membership to the CIPD, 3 months free access to HR Inform, and have paid £3,595.00 upfront for an online course, you expect what was offered. 

The situation - Course begins 5 November 2018 and runs until January 2020. Membership card from the CIPD arrives saying it expires on 1 July 2019, this is only 8 months free membership. Queried with Avado on 17/12/18 by telephone and it was verbally confirmed I get 12 months free membership and I must phone the CIPD. When speaking to a representative at the CIPD I discover their membership runs from June to June each year, and that Avado are aware of this. I email Avado on 17/12/18 querying if they will honour the four missing months (12 months free clearly shows on their invoice) I receive no response and have to chase them up on 02/01/19. I then received the following response: "I have raised this with our Quality and Compliance team to listen to your original enrollment call to understand what you were sold. This is because it is our understanding that CIPD membership can be given for up to 12 months long."

I then receive a response stating: "After looking further into your account I could see that the CIPD membership fees have been confirmed with us to be paid and the 4 months are being honored."

I then reply back requesting how they will honour the additional four months free membership and receive this response: "I can confirm that your membership has been paid for up until June which is the renewal date for memberships."

If you're going to honour the twelve months free membership that you have promised, tell me how you plan to reimburse me for the four months from July to October 2019 that you offered but hasn't been included!

Now lets move on to the HR Inform three month free subscription - they didn't bother to add the essential caveat that this is in fact not free at all - if you want the three free months, you have to pay for a 12 month subscription and you will then get 3 of those months for free.

Now lets move on to the Avado learning platform. It is glitchy and temperamental. You sign in with your username and there is a tickbox option to remember your username. Despite ticking this each time... your username is never remembered and you have to re-type it every single time you log in. 

Throughout the course there are discussion groups and in order to see others responses, you have to first post your response. You do this - and the platform then acknowledges you've done this but you're unable to view anyone else's response. You have to physically go back a day or more later before it allows you to see these. When you have limited time as it is, this is not useful!

Dates don't appear correctly on these and on the forums.

The course content - there are spelling and grammatical errors throughout. Yes, I know not everyone works to a standard of perfection, however when we are warned that our course submissions must be spell checked, I would have thought they would follow their own advice with the course content.

The group taking the course is large, which means they have split us down into smaller groups (even though this is all done online!) and as such, you don't get to read or learn from others experience on the question and answer forums, which I find extremely disappointing. I want to be able to read all the answers, not a select few from those who bother to do them (many don't) and from a small group of only +/- 23 people that they randomly select to place you with on a unit).

Each Unit consists of "lessons" which are made up of quizzes, reading, further research, question and answer forums, etc, which is great. If you click on one of the lessons, it automatically shows on the dashboard as being completed, despite the fact that you have in actual fact not finished it. It can be a little frustrating when you're interrupted and have to go back and find where you left off (this doesn't apply to every single individual "lesson").

Assessments - you are required to use Harvard Referencing which is fair enough. It is however an extremely steep learning curve for those of us who have never used it before. Links to resources were supplied, however I still had to do more research and then ask friends who have used Harvard referencing before for some guidance. Still not feeling that confident about whether I am using it correctly or not. Feedback from your assessments is helpful, although it leaves you with questions you don't know how to get answers to. 

On the positive side, the course content is informative and I appreciate how the "lessons" are broken down into segments with time required to complete - this is really useful.

I also have to add that if it wasn't for the fact that my CIPD membership and my query regarding it has been handled so badly, I wouldn't have bothered typing such an in-depth review.

18/01/19 - I do appreciate the proactive and quick response I have received from my review, thank you. I look forward to the improvements and appreciate the good customer support I have received.

headline: Excellent enrollment experience

This is my review based on my experience with Jonathan, the education consultant, who assisted me on my enrollment to CIPD Intermediate Diploma in Learning and Development. Note that this review is based on my pre-sales and enrollment experience. 

Overall, I felt that Jonathan was very responsive to my calls and emails, answered all my questions I have related to the programme, walk me through the online campus via screen sharing and took the time to share with me the payment options available. Overall the enrollment process was frictionless and smooth. After first payment, campus login and account activation was immediate.

headline: Really bad experience with these guys
reviewBody:
Really bad experience with these guys. They are very good at selling the courses but as far as the course and learning is concerned - terrible.
The organisation is poor. Course material is littered with mistakes (which makes things difficult when working with numbers that don't add up ). Classes tend to drop off after the first few weeks and aren't engaging in the slightest.  

I did all my learning through the AAT website which you pay membership for and didn't bother doing my second year. I didn't inform AVADO that i'd decided to not continue and haven't heard anything from them since and didn't even receive the course material for the second year anyway. 

A waste of money that you won't get back. I would recommend doing your research before getting involved.

(UPDATE.)

So AVADO rang me in the evening of their reply to my Trustpilot review. Strange that it takes a review in the public domain for them to action anything. 
Gent asked me on the phone if there was anything they could do to re engage me but its a little too late. I had asked for refund in previous complaints for my second year of study because the course was not up to standard and kept on getting the terms and conditions thrown at me. One of the terms is that you have 14 days after purchase to cancel if you wish and I was informed that if I wasn't happy with course material and mistakes that I should have stated within these 14 days. The terms make no sense. I hadn't received all the material at this point... and if you're learning a subject how are you meant to go through course materials and check for errors when you haven't learnt the content yet. I never even received the level 3 course material so couldn't have checked that for mistakes. More importantly, you don't expect something that you fork out a couple of grand for to have mistakes.

Avoid!
