reviewBody:
the way the initial time spent and the professionalism start brings about, simply reflects the organisational capabilities and approach.

great work and the team hopeful at cipd and avado will be supportive to as experienced 
cheers

headline: It looks very good.
reviewBody: It looks very good.

headline: E-sign document make it very easy to…
reviewBody: E-sign document make it very easy to enrol and automatically generated page for payment very easy to pay. Enrolment consultants are very helpful and trying to find ways to make this is easy as possible.

headline: Allison was extremely helpful without…
reviewBody: Allison was extremely helpful without being pushy when I was making to decision on which level to book and with who. This was followed by a smooth and speedy enrolment.

headline: Studying CIPD online
reviewBody: I was a bit skeptical about studying CIPD online so I did a lot of research but I decided to go with it for a few reasons; Jolene Stokes who gave me all the information I needed (several times) was amazing in helping me understand more about the course, what would be a good fit for me and the benefits Avado offers. I get the flexibility I need and the affordability factor too plus it's an interactive platform so this helps with the learning process. Overall a great experience with a professional advisor and company - the only company with an exclusive joint venture partnership with CIPD so all course material is CIPD's own content! I would highly recommend speaking to Jolene if you are considering any course with Avado!

headline: Terrible
reviewBody: Terrible company, was home learning college just changed the name, i never completed course on time and was advised by student services to complete THEN phone them for extension, when i did, they had discontinued course and said i wasnt entitled to refund but i could pay extra and do another course which none i wanted to do,they sent me a mickey mouse certificate of completion not even an original certificate and then told me it as a mistake and i never completed the course, they then lied and said they emailed my recent email to tell me they were discontinuing course which i never received, which they told me because i wasnt paying at the time i wouldnt of received it, huge disaster feeling such injustice, all my hard work and £800 of my hard earned money down the drain.

headline: An excellent organisation whether your…
reviewBody: An excellent organisation whether your reaching out to them over any aspect of ypur studies they are professionals in every aspect but do show an understanding and helpful side. I would recommend them to anyone wanting to study with as they give you confidence to keep going.

headline: Very supportive tutor
reviewBody: I was made redundant and decided to take my level 5 CIPD in Human Resources Managment. Being a stay at home mum while taking this course limited me in where I could source information to support my studying. My tutor Hayley Montgomery has been incredibly supportive and directed me in where to go and was always available on the phone/ email to listen to me and help guide me and explain things in greater detail so I was confident I was on the right track in achieving this certification.

headline: AVADO great place to study!
reviewBody: Wanted to say BIG thanks to AVADO for excellent CIPD HR Management studies experience! I am full time working single mom and online studies with AVADO was a great way to gain more knowledge and move on my career. "Difficult roads leads to beautiful destinations" once said best tutor in my life  Andy Murphy and he was right! It was  not easy, but rewarding!  Thank you Andy and All AVADO team that helped me reach my goal!

headline: CIPD Level 5 - Intermediate
reviewBody:
I have just completed my CIPD Level 5 in HR Management with Avado. It has taken just under a year, but has gone so quickly! Logging on for the first time was quite daunting, but I had a really great tutor (Andy Murphy) who has helped me, patiently, with my frequent questions and queries. The course was 6 assignments which were between 6-8 weeks each. I would say I spent about 8 hours a week on the coursework and writing assignments (more on the last one as it seemed to be a lot more intensive than the others - Employment Law). Sometimes it was hard going, but as Andy said there's no point doing a course if you aren't learning or challenging yourself. Now that I have finished I can appreciate that comment more!
Avado was really good at keeping information flowing and Andy was always contactable and replied really quickly to my direct emails. 
I found the tutor sessions the most helpful - some of the wording on the assignments (set by CIPD) seems so confusing when you first see it, but the tutor sessions definitely helped clarify what was needed. I would have been stuck without them!
Since passing I have been given a promotion (and pay rise) so the hard work is already paying off. Massive thanks to Avado, and specifically Andy, for getting me through it!

headline: I chose to do an online course rather than go to college because I needed greater flexibility of study time.
reviewBody:
AAT Level 3. I chose to do an online course rather then go to college because I needed flexibility. I was assured I would get this on enrolling but this was not the case. The course runs to a strict schedule and if you get behind it is hard to catch up. Access to the system is terminated when their schedule dictates you should have finished the course, although they did extend my access free of charge when I explained the personal circumstances which had caused me to get behind.
The tutor was great and answered all of my queries promptly and was very helpful but I wouldn’t have had so many queries or wasted as much time if there wasn’t so many errors (and I mean loads of errors) in the weekly assessment questions/answers.
I won’t be continuing my studies with Avado.

headline: No chasing up to see if you are ok
reviewBody: I gone missing off course and not one person was able to help me. If you go missing in a physical college you have tutors trying to find you and get you back on track but no one checked up on me to see if I was ok or anything

headline: CIPD Level 3 - Fantastic!
reviewBody: I joined in March 2018. I haven't yet completed my course, which I truly hope to pass by next year. However, I can say with total confidence that this course has been so enlightening. I completed a degree in 2013, where I studied full-time. I can say that with my with Avado I had more contact time with my tutor (Les) than during my time at university. I couldn't have loved this experience more. Please note that there is a lot work, but I feel the final result will definitely be worth it. Thanks Avado, and a special thanks to my tutor Les!!!

headline: I waited 1 month for my assessment to…
reviewBody: I waited 1 month for my assessment to be checked by a tutor.

headline: Great service. Thank you
reviewBody:
Commendable Professionalism displayed. 
Swift service provided. 

Go beyond great e.g. look up basic information about customer location / country to tailor conversations.

headline: Lack of communication
reviewBody: Whilst everyone that I spoke to at Avado was polite and friendly, I found the lack of communication a bit frustrating as it took multiple phone calls to chase an invoice for me to arrange to be paid so I could start my course, as well as a delay in receiving my login details meaning I didn't have much time to look at the course outline ahead of starting.

headline: Very easy and friendly staff
reviewBody: Very easy and friendly staff

headline: Excellent learning platform
reviewBody: Excellent learning platform. Structured, the mix of various contents - text, videos, activities, PPTs, student knowledge sharing...Very user-friendly. Fantastic student support. Would like to give special thanks to Vanesa Serafini; she is a great tutor.

headline: While doing the certificate we actually…
reviewBody: While doing the certificate we actually had a good communication and interaction with tutor and students. When doing the diploma, I felt a bit left out, which was not the best as I'm not experienced in this subject. A good experience but would not recommend someone with no background on the subject to jump to a level 5 as me once advised by the sales person

headline: Did not respond to requests to return…
reviewBody: Did not respond to requests to return calls and emails, once monies paid.

headline: Levels 3 and 4 of the AAT syllabus
reviewBody: I completed levels 3 and 4 of the AAT syllabus with AVADO. The reading materials were very useful and easy to read but there should have been more chances to practise the different skills. I didn’t contact the tutors very often but when I did, they got back to me quickly with an answer to my question.

headline: It could have been excellent but the delivery let it down
reviewBody: Although the content of the course was excellent, the delivery was poor and the tutor support was non existent. Basic questions were left unanswered and the only real 'tutoring' you would receive was if you were referred for a unit. The discussions and weekly tasks on the LMS were rarely followed up even if the task would say a tutor will provide guidance at a later date. Not sure what the purpose of the online tutorials were as these would often not cover topics useful for the assignment.  The student services were borderline useless - difficult to get hold off and emails were replied sometimes 3 weeks after emailing. I learner a lot but this was down to working closely with my fellow students and doing a lot of research myself. I feel that I really paid for the title of my certificate and not much else.

headline: The enrollment process was very easy
reviewBody:
The enrollment process was very easy.  Staff very helpful with different elements such as trying to understand what you get for your money, content, etc.
Using the virtual learning campus is easy once you give time to navigate your way around it.  
A good way to gain the qualification without having to go to an evening class etc.

headline: Average at best
reviewBody: Average at best. Communication is poor, especially with student services as I have experianced emails which take over a week to get a response. The online lessons are not great, especially for the level 4 extra exams. I wouldn't recommend

headline: The course was not structured correctly…
reviewBody: The course was not structured correctly and as such students under a lot of stress.

headline: Hit and Miss
reviewBody:
Overall the experience was only satisfactory, considering the cost of the service. 
The learning platform had non responsive links, a few videos were missing which were part of the modules and would have been useful when writing assignments. There was inconsistency with hand in dates on several occasions, requiring students to chase up Avado to get official confirmation - they did not see the error until then. Some of the links were dated for previous cohorts so felt like we were getting second hand material.
The tutors were helpful when approached but the communications around tutor changes were lacking.
Based on my experience alone I would not recommend Avado especially if you are funding this yourself and not through your employer.

headline: Excellent Service
reviewBody: Excellent support and interaction for Course enrollment. The process is very quick! I was enrolled just one day after my call with the consultant. Amazing!!! Looking forward to the course :)

headline: Easy enough
reviewBody: Easy enough. They were happy to invoice my employer as they were covering the cost.

headline: Put me off L7 with them
reviewBody: Signed up to Avado for a CIPD L5 L&D Diploma and to start it was fantastic - great guest speakers, tutor knowledge and structure. However, as you continued through the units you saw some of the cracks in Student Services' abilities. They were unable to get back to students in timely manner, the dates on the sites were incorrect and the tutor support was infrequent. As much as I have enjoyed a lot of the content of my studies, it has put me off doing L7 with them.

headline: Hoping things have changed
reviewBody:
I signed up when this was Home Learning College and I feel I was misinformed. 
The course looked perfect for me, but I knew I'd have to wait a while to start. The advisor told me I could sign up straight away and complete it when I had the time without mentioning I'd have to pay to extend the course. As expected, I couldn't complete it in time and ended up throwing lots of money at a course I ultimately didn't complete. I mentioned this to other advisors and nothing was done. 
The tutors and the course content was excellent, but the customer service was poor and has put me off doing future online courses.

headline: It would seem that all avado are…
reviewBody: It would seem that all avado are interested in is your money. If you become unable to continue your studies, even right at the beginning of the course due to tragic circumstances they will still insist on taking payment in full for the entire course.

headline: Rachel was excellent
reviewBody: Rachel was excellent! She made the entire process clear and simple but most of all stress free. Rachel also has a good sense of  humour which helped me to instantly connect with her. Thank you!

headline: Great opportunity missed due to poor tutors and out of date content
reviewBody: Hit and miss tutors, some great some poor. Virtual learning course with some good content but also some out of date content. Not as interactive as I would have liked.

headline: Happy student
reviewBody: I was happy with them

headline: Absolutely awful providers
reviewBody: Absolutely awful providers! I’d mark them as a 0 or negative numbat if that was an option. No contact or feedback. I felt that I’d been cheated out of my hard earned cash!  When I complained I was fobbed off and would ask people to avoid at all costs.

headline: Avado enrolment process
reviewBody: Enrolment process was very straightforward and easy to follow.

headline: The learning environment that they are…
reviewBody: The learning environment that they are so proud of is terrible. Answers are marked as wrong that are correct, it can't recognise numbers in a slightly different format. There are only big tests that take forever to finish there are no small do I know what I'm doing questions to test your knowledge. I honestly gave up and went to a different provider I got so sick of how useless these guys were.

headline: Excellent Student services from entry…
reviewBody:
Excellent Student services from entry to exit , if you are looking to find that work , learn balance   then you have the best training provider "AVADO" 
I did it , I am now Senior HR Operational Manager in a Stand alone position !!
Tutors are experts in their field and give support and guidance throughout your course.

I highly recommend AVADO to anyone who wants to gain a qualification , to enhance their skill set  or even to move into another industry.

Give it a go , you will be glad you did !!

Chris Assoc.CIPD

headline: Queried the overall price as friend…
reviewBody: Queried the overall price as friend paid alot less for the same package, was firstly told it had never been that price, then they said it had, was told it wasn't gonna be that price again - signed up paying extra £500 then 1 month later they have 20% offer back on

headline: Avoid AVADO
reviewBody:
My tutor was rude and brusque and rarely responded to queries with complete answers, I constantly had to go back for clarification. .

The only way to get a helpful response in time was to say I was going on holiday and needed a response ASAP. If I didn't do that, he would respond the day my assignment was due in, which meant that I would fail because I didn't get his feedback until in time. 

I tried to complain to student services, and their service was very poor. They were totally unempathetic and said that no one else had complained and that he was a really popular tutor. I responded I knew others had complained because they had told me that they too had a lack of adequate guidance and that they had. Student services tried to make me speak to my tutor, and I explained I didn't feel comfortable with that because he was so rude and dismissive on the video/skype-like tutorials, and emails, and they still tried to push it and said they'd "look into it". Neither I , nor any of my cohorts did get any help.

The most frustrating thing was when I received a very rude email from my tutor, and I forwarded it to student services explaining how upsetting this was, and that I didn't feel comfortable dealing with him because of his rudeness. They just forwarded it back to my tutor, who then sent me a defensive email telling me to call him if I had a problem. 

His abrupt and bullying attitude was stressful and intimidating, and many of my fellow students also complained about this. AVADO did nothing to help, and were obstructive, defensive, and unempathetic. 

I've completed several similarly set up courses, and Avado were by far the worst. I would definitely encourage avoiding them.


Edit: 5 November

Thanks for the offer Victoria.

I don't wish to relive a very stressful experience. I complained on 3 or 4 occasions over 11 months, and at no point was I taken seriously or given any empathy or understanding. The time I should have been listened to was the time of the original complaints, and not just when I posted my review of the poor service I received.

If AVADO do want to address these issues, I suggest they listen to their customers when concerns are raised, and not many months later because of a review. As I was not listened to on many occasions I'm sure you understand why I don't wish to rehash it again.

headline: Worst experience of my life
reviewBody: I decided not to continue my studies with Avado given the poor experience I had over the first year. The change in tutors/head of programmes made for a very inconsistent learning experience. On top of that I have called to ask for the certificate of the module I did complete which has still not arrived, although promised to be sent out once I had decided not to continue. It has been nearly a year since I left the course.

headline: Really well organised
reviewBody: Really well organised. Excellent tutor support and feedback. Always a quick response to any queries. For someone who has been out of the student life for many years- it was excellent and thinking about doing my next level in a year or so

headline: Total waste of money.
reviewBody: Total waste of money.

headline: Generally good experience
reviewBody: I have found acado very straight forward and am enjoying the course! The guy who I originally spoke to when signing up to the course was very helpful and gave an in depth and detailed description! They only thing I was disappointed with is that he ran a credit check and advised me I would have to make payments of over £700 a month until the course was paid out! I only had one late payment of a day on a phone bill and despite having a mortgage and many other bills which have been paid on time for the past six years I was refused the monthly payment option. I understand the credit score is pre- determined and out of your control however I think you need to be more flexible and realistic given that students tend to not have that type of money.

headline: Bad training provider
reviewBody: Bad training provider, do not explain the full requirements before u pay then refuse to give a refund!! £1400 now wasted and never got back!

headline: Total waste of time & money I’d give a…
reviewBody: Total waste of time & money I’d give a score of minus 5 if possible. Initially the course was tough & EVERY student was complaining about the lack of guidance especially us who weren’t in HR at the time as a lot of the course asked you to see or seek advice or work with your HR manager if you didn’t you were told to imagine what one would say!!!  Add to this the fact I had spoken to an advisor prior to choosing the course explained my education level and was advised this would be the correct course imagine my surprise when my tutor told us this was a University degree level course. Bit higher than I am used to by some margin as I don’t think NVQ Carpentry & construction is quite degree level. After having to take a one month break from studies due to serious injury it was hard to get started again. Not just because of the break but the total mismanagement by student services. After 6 months of them saying we will activate your studies again soon I FINALLY managed to get my course restarted but it was not only the wrong module it wasn’t at the start I was already a month behind after several attempts at getting things restarted properly & a curt ‘it’s not our problem’ I gave up as I was utterly confused as to where I was course wise. Refund? Not policy I was told & then ignored utter waste of £3,000 which I certainly could not afford to lose. Asked legal advise but cost prohibited action so have to just accept I wasted £3,000. So my advise? Find another learning provider.

headline: Average amount of support
reviewBody:
Average amount of support, I expected more due to the ratings and reviews.
Tutor support isn't great and not proactively helpful. I was told I would receive free CIPD membership but has not yet come through, though I need it for my assignment.
I was told I would receive a Microsoft package over the phone, then when I had paid £4000 for the course I did not receive it because I 'did not have any email chains' to prove this was promised.

All in all, pretty poor.

headline: Not entirely great
reviewBody: Not entirely great. The salesman promises alot that wasn't delivered, I had to make complaints just get what was promised to me as part of the sales process. The e-learning was often incorrect (example: "your answer is correct" even though the 'correct' answer that it showed exactly matched my answer). The study books had spelling and mathematical errors in them, confirmed when I queried with my tutor. If you're looking for an unsupported, overpriced and pretty lack luster study provider, choose Avado!

headline: Books are good quality
reviewBody: Books are good quality. Online learning is clunky,  time consuming and has too many errors. Please proof read

headline: Terrible
reviewBody: They cancelled my course whilst I was in the middle of it and removed resources and tutor availability before I had completed. Terrible customer service and overall a negative experience.

headline: Shockingly poor
reviewBody:
If you are considering an accounting course, avoid Avado like the plague. 
The course was not fully explained when I signed up. It was implied that I could practice bookkeeping when I qualified. I can’t. I am expected to go back and take another course. 
Their source books are poorly written  and do not prepare you for the exam. 
My tutor very rarely got back to me if I sent her emails regarding the course or the exam. 
On the whole, the live lessons were banal and poorly delivered. This was reflected in the way that the number of pupils online diminished each week. 
I’m short: an absolute waste of money.

headline: Very good staff with lots of knowledge
reviewBody: Very good staff with lots of knowledge.  I was looking for AAT course  which I can do from home with working and looking after my little one.  All the services were very quick.  Received all the information by emails.  Received my books very quick as well.

headline: A huge rip off
reviewBody: Horrendous experience. Tried to cancel after their 14 day cooling off period. However I hadn't received my books in this time so wasn't given any actual time to decide if it was the course for me. After then finally giving into paying the £1550 for the level 3 and 4 courses that they would not let me leave. I have decided to skip level 3 as I have covered majority at university- and was told if I found level 3 easy I could do this when I first took on the course and its costs. They are now refusing to give me my level 4 access or even books- which I have paid £1550 for! Absolutely awful customer service. Just wish I had never got in touch with them from the start! More debt from this company than university itself.

headline: Great service
reviewBody:
Great service, Jolene is great 👍👍

I am still waiting for the access

headline: Thanks
reviewBody: Thanks, very much appricieted

headline: 100% recommended! Fantastic experience and I will miss studying with Avado!
reviewBody: I had a fantastic experience studying with Avado, having recently completed my CIPD Level 5 Certiciate. I was really impressed with the whole study system, from the online portal which was really easy to access, to my amazingly supportive tutor (Andy) who was always on hand to help when ever needed (especially in moments of self-created panic!). The regular online seminars were great and allowed the whole cohort to ask lots of questions about the assessments and share thoughts and ideas. I would thoroughly recommend Avado to anyone, and I look forward to studying with them again in the near future.

headline: Signing up
reviewBody: Slick and easy sign up procedures. Really helpful, friendly and knowledgable employees.  Really put my mind at rest and am now fully looking forward to my studies

headline: This enrolment process was very…
reviewBody: This enrolment process was very straightforward although I did waste some time looking for an automated process before realising you have to speak to someone before the enrolment can be started.

headline: Enrolment
reviewBody:
Please note that this review is based on the enrolment process as I have not completed the course (i.e. I have ten months and seven assessments left to go!) Jonathan L was extremely helpful during the enrolment process - for example he called at times to suit me (outside office hours) for pre-enrolment discussions. My payment method was changed at last minute but with his help I was still able to start the course on time. 

I will also say however that the course tutors have been very helpful so far and have responded to any questions I have asked very quickly.

headline: If you would like to become CIPD Qualified please do not book with Avado
reviewBody:
Firstly, I have never written a review but really feel the need to in this instance as the experience I had with Avado is not one I wish anyone else to have. 
After spending the best part of £3500 in 2016 Avado have lost all my work, I have no certificates of qualifications and the customer service is some of the worst I have experienced.  The turn over of staff at Avado meant that I didn't speak to the same tutor very often and in the end, the customer service manager did not even respond to my emails.  

I sincerely hope that anyone chosing to pay for a CIPD qualification doesn't book with Avado.

headline: I have just signed up to study the CIPD…
reviewBody:
I have just signed up to study the CIPD Level 5 Diploma.  My contact so far has been very helpful and my queries have been dealt with well and speedily.

I have yet to start studying, but so far they have been great!

headline: Both Allison and Rachel who I dealt…
reviewBody: Both Allison and Rachel who I dealt with at AVADO went above and beyond to help me make the right decision on the course I needed. I can't thank them enough.

headline: The enrollment process was really easy…
reviewBody: The enrollment process was really easy and super fast and Ashley was very helpful, open and a great conversation partner. He surely knows how to sell this course. :)

headline: Excellent customer service and course content
reviewBody: The agent I spoke to was excellent (Cheryl Ball) and didn't rush through explaining everything to me and answering all my questions. Throughout she demonstrated her excellent knowledge and experience of the product and services and did not pressure me in any way to make an immediate decision. As I was funding the course myself I wanted to take time to consider everything. She was happy to make the options very clear in terms of payment and called me on a Sunday to answer any further questions I had. I was more than happy then to book my place on the course. Thank you Cheryl!

headline: Brilliant Learning Provider!
reviewBody:
Avado is a great learning provider. The tutors are enthusiastic and brilliant at their jobs! The courses cater for all styles of learning, videos, textbook, activities etc.
Massive thanks to the staff at Avado!

headline: I have not yet started my course
reviewBody: I have not yet started my course, but my experience so far with signing up and communications answering all my questions has been really good. I hope my learning experience will be as good as, hopefully better than, the interaction I have had so far.

headline: Poor service
reviewBody: Paid for the future HR & Learning portal subscription but didn't receive any login  details, no follow up and communication even thought emails are sent to enquire on this. Lodged a case with paypal n got my refund

headline: User friendly and easy to navigate
reviewBody: User friendly and easy to navigate

headline: Excellent service
reviewBody: From the first phone call to enrolling on the course, was great. Really helpful, answered any questions well, explained everything great, got all information emailed out quickly & efficiently, and always replied to emails/calls quickly! Highly recommend.

headline: EMPLOYERS DO NOT PAY FOR A COURSE PROVIDED BY THIS COMPANY
reviewBody:
Warning to Employers. This company demands payment upfront.  We paid a total of £2497.00 for a student to complete this course consisting of three modules.  The student left the firm and moved to Scotland and so did not utilise most of the services supposed to be provided by this company.  Because we had not cancelled the course within the 14 day cooling off period, Avado refuse to refund any monies.
We asked if they would, instead, give a credit note as we will have three more students commencing the same studies shortly - no.  
We will never again use this company.

headline: Initial communication
reviewBody: Initial communication with Avado was great.  They were not 'pushy' and really cared about making sure you were choosing the right course for you.  I am really pleased so far and hope it continues through the course.

headline: Great enrolment process
reviewBody: Great enrolment process - quick and easy and the advisors really put me at ease and ensured I had all the information I needed to make the right decision.

headline: Typical AVADO service:
reviewBody:
Typical AVADO service:
You will receive apologies like this below
Hello Inga,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. 
We’re sorry to hear that you haven’t had the best experience studying with us and sincerely apologise for any inconvenience caused.
We take all expressions of dissatisfaction very seriously and have passed your feedback to the relevant individuals involved, as it’s important for AVADO to see how best to improve our students experience.
I have asked our student services team to contact you directly to discuss all concerns raised, so please look out for our call and/or email. 
We’re sorry to have let you down on this occasion and look forward to speaking with you soon. 
Kind regards,
AVADO

And then they go silent again :)
Been with them for almost a year now (taking online course) and no matter how many complaints you send them the response is complete by acknowledging your struggles and that is it. Good in apologising but no further real solutions. 
So unless your experience with their platform is going smoothly you will not be enjoying dealing with them.

headline: Love Avado
reviewBody: Love Avado! They are enthusiastic, not at all patronizing or scary. The tutors are always available for any questions and happy to help. The information on the platform is great and various depending on different learning styles everyone has a good chance to understand the syllabus. They have a very high pass rate for a reason: they care and they will make sure you are comfortable with the information and you are on the right track throughout the course. Also, the videos are great to watch.

headline: CIPD
reviewBody: Thank you for let me join your CIPD class it is my pleasure to be one of your member I would be happy to get the certificate to be announced that I get it from your collage

headline: I have found Avado very helpful and…
reviewBody:
I have found Avado very helpful and professional in helping and supporting me to get back into my studies for a CIPD course . 
They were helpful without being pushy or aggressive in their sales approach . And have continued to provide help as needed .

headline: I was deciding on which course to do…
reviewBody: I was deciding on which course to do and when I spoke to Saba, she was extremely helpful and guided me in the right direction for me. She was very informative and an asset to avado. Thanks you.

headline: Enrolment process was so smooth and…
reviewBody: Enrolment process was so smooth and easy. I was given lots of information to help make my mind up. The help throughout the full process was professional and made it so simple.

headline: Great communication
reviewBody: Great communication but not over the top, made it really easy to sign up to the course that I am doing. Really excited to get going 😁

headline: Absolutely shocking service from Avado…
reviewBody: Absolutely shocking service from Avado Learning.  Having originally enrolled with Home Learning College everything started well, but with paying over £7k for a top level qualification the support and level of service was never there once Avado took over.  Very high drop out rate in the cohort due to changing course leads on numerous occasions throughout the 2 years of study.  Very unhelpful, new staff placed, extremely rude tutors in some modules, the list is endless...save yourself some money and shop around, other providers cost less and actually care about their students. It says it all, that they are no longer offering the qualification...maybe because they can't deliver and many paid for a full qualification only to have to reduce to a lesser certificate as insufficient student support was provided.

headline: Enrollment process itself was great but…
reviewBody: Enrollment process itself was great but did not receive a receipt for my tuition payment.

headline: Very happy with the enrolment process 😊
reviewBody: My Enrolment Consultant was Solomon Gebremedhin, he was very knowledgeable about the various courses and a pleasure to talk to. He gave me all the information I needed to make an informed decision about which course to study. He answered all of my questions satisfactorily and didn’t put any pressure on me at all to book a course with AVADO. I have signed up for the ACCA Full Qualification and I’m really looking forward to getting started! Thanks again Solomon for all your help 😊

headline: Excellent training provider
reviewBody: Excellent training provider, i studied ACCA with them would highly recommend due to their well bulit online campus and support from the team.

headline: Very Poor Support, they are only after your money
reviewBody:
I have registered & paid 789.75 pound as 1st Installment for CIPD level 5 certification on 20th Aug'18 for Sep batch, as they confirmed course start during 1st week of Sep'18, then complete silence, then again after so many mail unanswered, then i received a email stating batch start on 3rd Sep'18, user name, password, tutor email, contact number provided, I logged in to start the course to my surprise nothing is allocated to my login.Again several emails & no one response from customer service number +44 208 080 6491, due to this very much disappointed by the way service is rendered, further i was frighted how the learning support would be. waited till 18th Sep'18 nothing happened. So decided to withdraw from CIPD course with huge financial loss (anyway requested for refund as they haven't fill filled there commitment as learning service).
My advice to other, Marketing call from them would be good, but student support is worst and will put you into sleepless nights.
very bad experience

headline: Extremely Disappointing!
reviewBody:
Had a fantastic experience setting up the courses! Could not have been better. Received emails and phone calls. Then...

Needed to contact reference the course and a potential deferment! SIX phone calls...gave up after five of them as I was waiting 22 minutes or more! Have sent THREE emails and FOUR days later I’m still awaiting a response!!! Shocking!

Clearly great at taking money!

headline: CIPD Level 5
reviewBody: I recently completed a CIPD Level 5 course with Avado. Whilst it was occasionally hard to juggle study time with "everything else in life", it was also great fun. Our tutor & the Student Services team were great at keeping us motivated along the way and were very quick to respond to any queries I had. The VLC is easy to navigate and instructions were really clear. The regular live tutor sessions & online cafe cohorts were incredibly helpful.  If you want a course that you can fit in around a busy job/life, I'd highly recommend this one.

headline: So glad I chose Avado
reviewBody:
Sales person very helpful and a student themselves. 
Online campus easy to use and weekly tasks to complete keep me focused and on track. Regular video lessons also good and someone always on hand for advice. 
Really glad I chose Avado.

headline: Review of AVADO / Not reached to the expected quality
reviewBody:
The e-learning system has technical problems and I was unable to view the video contents so many times. I have already sent two e-mail to course coordinator and also one to the general entry account. However, there is no response so far. 

The instructions and clarifications made by the course supporting staff and coordinator have not clear and processional.  They have not addressed the points of queries raised by the students or sometime only partial information.

headline: I have been unable to get through on…

I am still waiting and have sent an email only to get an automated response saying they are experiencing technical problems, a second day of problems as the VLC portal was unable yesterday to students. headline: Process was very smooth with always…
reviewBody: Process was very smooth with always available assistance and support from service team

headline: Not what i  expected at all!  Please Avoid!
reviewBody: Not what i  expected at all! No communication once you are enrolled.  When I called in June to ask about the  CIPD  course,  the calls were never ending and I  could not  have  asked for a more friendly  bunch  of  people.  I signed up and was not told that  I  would be  financed for this course through a loan company.  I stupidly filled  in  the  forms and  started the course.  When I started having personal issues and  wanted to  put my course on hold, I  could not get hold of anyone! Call after call was ignored and emails were not responded to  in spite of  an automated  email saying that  I  would get a response  in 3 days. A month on and I  called again and managed to get through  a person  called Jonathan.  I was told that  I would  need to  get  someone else to  do  my course as I  cannot cancel due to  the  14 day right to cancel period having expired.  My frustration  is that how could I  cancel if no one picked up my calls? I  then asked  about  deferral and Jonathan  seemed surprised  at the prospect.  This is  the advise  my tutor gave me when I  called her to explain  why I  could not  continue  with the course. Jonathan  asked me to  email student services explaining that  I  wanted to  defer the course. When I  asked  about cancelling ,  he said I needed to  call the Finance  Company.  I called the finance company  and  was informed that they had paid Avado the full amount  for the  course and that I now owed them the money. I  was told that  I would only get a refund  if Avado allowed this ie Avado would need to  refund them what they paid on my behalf.  I  was recently  diagnosed  with  breast cancer and when I  signed up for the course I honestly thought  I  could handle doing the course and working.  The stress has however proven to be too much  as I also had to  change jobs recently.  All of this has meant that  I  can't continue with the course and a little  bit of  understanding  would have been appreciated and not reading out company  policy  of a script.  It is a pity that I  have  to air my problems on such a public platform  but I have been left with no  choice  as another week has gone by after my last correspondence  and I  am still waiting.  Surely everything  can't be  so black and white especially  as Avado has gone back on its word to respond  to queries within 3 working days. I am so stressed about  all of  this  and have lost all trust in Avado who initially were so helpful  on signing me up.

headline: let down
reviewBody:
Hello,

I registered for an AAT course a few years ago and within a few months I had to stop studying due to serious health issues. I contacted you over the phone and emails a few times ever since but all my communication got ignored. I paid over £2000 for the course and I haven’t been refunded any bit of it. I feel very disappointed for it all especially with the fact that when I was looking for a course, you were all trying to be nice and reachable immediately. But when circumstances changed, nobody has ever responded.

headline: Not getting what you pay for!
reviewBody:
I am overall disappointed!! I only went with this company for the good reviews... upon enrolling I had to call twice to chase where my course books were... I got them 3 weeks after enrolling! 
I didn’t even know who my tutor was... when I did know and sent an email it was a week later I received any kind of help which is essential when distance learning. 
I then go to try to claim my NUS card and apparently there is an issue so I’m added to a list?
Is this some sort of joke? I’ve paid good money for crap service ! Not happy at all

headline: Study elsewhere if you value your time and sanity
reviewBody:
Awful. 
Note that the majority of the reviews are based on enrolment; and they're right. Avado are very eager to sign you up. I actually enquired about my CIPD level 3, but somehow got persuaded into signing up to Level 5 even though I'd never worked in HR. I was told that the course could be completed by committing 6hrs per week. 
I'm currently averaging 20 hours per week. 
Why? Because the course material is severely lacking. Referencing is a nightmare and the tutors are broken records, repeating the same sentence no matter how many times someone says "I don't understand". I STILL haven't found a reference for Ulrich's 3-legged stool that matches the one quoted in the material... and in the second assignment, my tutor gave the instruction "the reference is really hard to find so just use 'Author (date)' and it'll be fine". If the reference is THAT hard to find, it shouldn't be core material... and the person marking the assignment DID pick up on it. 
Assignment 3, and the questions ("assessment criteria") aren't in the same sequence as the course weeks... the theory being that you can start your assignment as you study through the weeks...  but part of the second question I've JUST discovered in week 5. THREE WEEKS of wondering what it was referring to, and TOTALLY misunderstanding (the chat transcript said "This is an easy one", so I just assumed I was overthinking it. NO. 
This course has been massively stressful and had a hugely negative impact on my life and health. Not because the course is difficult, but because the material provided is insufficient, unclear, unreferenced (there's not even a clear index to find exactly where information is!!) and the support is slow and indifferent. Unless you don't work during office hours... then you might get a quick response. 
I have two colleagues studying their CIPD 5 & 7 with other institutions, and they don't face these problems. If you want your CIPD qualifications, look elsewhere.

headline: AAT 2&3
reviewBody: Just enrolled onto the level 2 AAT course. Managed to get a great discount by paying for the level 3 at the same time. My advisor Marc was fantastic, he was always available to answer any questions and made the whole process quick and easy. Only just started learning but 1st impressions of the online learning campus are very good! Highly recommend Avado...

headline: Would not reccommend
reviewBody:
I have just completed my AAT Level 3 with Avado and have moved training providers for Level 4 and would not reccommend to anyone to use them for AAT. Student Services are pretty much non existant - they are certainly not a 'service'. Emails never get responded to at all. I have sent so many emails that have not even been acknowledged with a 'sorry we are busy and we will get back to you' kind of email, you just get nothing back. Or there was an occaision where I emailed as I needed help relating to an exam I was due to take - this one got responded to but weeks later after I had already taken the exam! There are some incorrect and conflicting answers on their online tests where their book says one thing and the tests say another thing. My exams were included in the course fee but they stopped using my local exam centre half way through my course so since then I've had to pay myself and claim the money back and this takes a minimum of about a month - both times only after I have emailed and called to chase it up too, not actually done of their own accord! If you call them then you are always on hold for at least about 10 minutes and then when they do pick up they are so unhelpful. I would give 0 stars for customer service - the only reason I have given 2 stars is because the layout of the course in weekly training is good and the live classes were helpful (if you had one of the good tutors which I was lucky enough to have!). The sales team will be very quick to respond to you and seem very helpful but don't get pulled in by this, because as soon as you've paid and it gets moved from Sales to Student Services then you get nothing.

**EDIT** Avado have replied to my review but student services have STILL not replied to my email! And I am STILL waiting for a reimbursement of my exam fee from a month ago (3 emails and 2 phone calls later)! They have, however, appeared to have listened to something and there is now an auto response on their emails to say they are very busy.

headline: Jonathan Banks ( enrolment consultant )…
reviewBody:
Jonathan Banks ( enrolment consultant ) is the guy to talk to... 50 min phone call. Explains everything you need to know if your not sure what path is the right one for you. Professional and understanding. What more you need? This was my first time calling AVADO and not the last. Very happy he picked up the phone. 
Phone: 02038935453

Thank you!

headline: I am currently doing the CIPD Level 3
reviewBody:
I am currently doing the CIPD Level 3 in HR and I was nervous about online learning as I work full time and do not have the best time management! However, I have surprised myself and passed 3 units so far :)
I am able to alternate my study days each week to fit around my schedule so I have a good study/life balance. The online activities clearly lead me through what I need to learn and are actually quite enjoyable as there are little animations and interactive sections. 
My tutor is very responsive to emails and sends continuous emails to us all, alongside online tutor sessions to cover any grey areas or trickier points to understand.
Overall I am really enjoying the course and the practical element to the activities and assessment is enabling me to input what I am learning into my role as well.

headline: I would never use Avado again.
reviewBody:
Avado have provided the worst customer service I have ever encountered. 
When you sign up you have 14 days to change your mind, regardless of the start date of your cohort. Once the course started and I realised it was totally inappropriate I called Avado. After being on hold for quite some time I was told to email what I had said in and in some cases they would be able to remove me from the course, this I was told would take 3 days. 
I call a few days later and I was on hold every time, once for an hour. I gave up. The next day a member of the Avado team told me they had been on an away day, so nobody was answering the phones. 
After yet another day of waiting, I was told it would take 8 weeks! To investigate. I said this was unacceptable and within a few days was told I could not withdraw from the course. 
Obviously this seems ridiculous as I did not have full access to the content until I started the course, I can only presume they want people to sign up the week before the cohort starts? 
I have now spent over £3000 on a course I do not wish to partake in, but they will not assist in any way. 
I emailed the Manager of student services during this whole incident and didn’t even receive an acknowledgement, which really demonstrates their customer service priorities. 
I would not recommend anyone uses Avado, as the service (as soon as you pay) is just terrible.

headline: First Class Throughout!
reviewBody:
I signed up with AVADO to complete the Diploma in Accounting & Business which entails completing the F1-F3 exams.  With no previous experience in the 'dark arts' of either accountancy or book-keeping, I was looking for a provider that would allow me to study in my own time, yet keep moving forward at a reasonable pace - and offer the one-to-one interaction that I knew I would rely on.  

In short, I wasn't disappointed.  AVADO's books, website, their embedded videos, progress tests, pre-exam resources and - most importantly - the quality of teaching, are absolutely first-class. The two tutors than guided me through my modules are masters of their subject and gifted teachers.  To the extent that I had dealings with the support staff, again they were swift, polite, effective and efficient.  

In sum, I wouldn't hesitate in recommending them to others wishing to follow a similar path.

headline: nice website, shame everything else is appalling
reviewBody:
The initial sales and marketing is top notch, they know how to be professional and slick. They  offer financing and are responsive to any questions. 

However the problems start once you have actually signed up, they don't seem to follow the concepts they teach. I am studying a level 5 certificate in HR management, I am learning about communication, being open and transparent and how to deal with issues as they arise. None of this is on display at Avado.

The course materials have grammatical errors, some modules are diabolical while others contain errors that require deciphering from the tutor. Generally, I rarely use the online materials they provide, its often much easier to find alternative sources of information, as they actually define and explain ideas well.

The tutor is hired on a part-time basis, but feels like we are a burden to her life. Sessions with her are usually about clarifying the online materials or what the assessment questions actually mean. There is no teaching provided whatsoever. 

I participated in a feedback session with the company and they were "very interested" in my feedback. Offered to request further details from me - this was 3 months ago - I still have not heard a peep from them even after I reminded them. They have no real interest in what you have to say, but I am positive I will get some generic PR blurb reply stating "we are always interested in our students feedback and so sorry blah blah". 

Avado have  a great business model, they take on about 60 students paying over £3k for a course and then happily cut corners wherever possible. You are not provided with any meaningful tools, their learning hub has some interesting features and looks very polished. But thats where all the investment went. 

There must be better providers out there, offering better value for money. Offering better quality of teaching.

headline: I've hated doing my course through…
reviewBody:
****Update 18/07/2018****
Avado have taken 2 months and still having called me. According to one email correspondence they're still investigating my complaint on bad service, and at this rate my course will end, I will be out of pocket and still not received any help.

*****UPDATE******
Avado were quick to leave a response on here, but it's been over 20 days and they've still not responded to my complaint, followed up on my call or emails, and still think it's reasonable for me to ask to keep chasing them.
******

I've hated doing my course through Avado.

Initially I wanted to do a level 3 but was pressured to do a level 5 as my degree meant it was 'more my level', but this course is incredibly difficult if you don't work within the industry.

The courses are labelled with the wrong dates from Alston year, units are mixed up in a misguided attempt at being useful, however no explanations for this. You can't see a percentage of your pass rate, the submission calenders are empty without events etc.

You can only use this site on a recent version of Windows, as the 'flexible' course is not available on any other devices. Something to bear in mind, as Adobe Connect (the high usage program required to watch the live videos) with consume slot of your computer's usage until it becomes a frozen typewriter.

The complaints/enquiries proceeded is really poor. I spent my lunch breaks on hold, only to be transferred to an unknown answer machine, and emails get replied to significantly late.

I really regret doing my course with Avado.

*****UPDATE******
Avado were quick to leave a response on here, but it's been over 20 days and they've still not responded to my complaint, followed up on my call or emails
*******

headline: I contacted Avado to make an enquiry…
reviewBody:
I contacted Avado to make an enquiry about doing a CIPD course, they responded quickly and answered all my questions.
The instructions and emails were easy to follow, and my conversations with Rachel my enrolment consultant were friendly and informative.
I am looking forward to starting the course.

headline: My registration went very well and was…
reviewBody:
My registration went very well and was handled expertly by Evie Lording.
She was very helpful and knowledgeable and the process was remarkably quick.
I have had a brief look at the portal and it looks better than when I last used it 18 months ago.
I'm looking forward to studying towards my Level 4 AAT.
Many thanks.

headline: Jae was a professional and a lovely…
reviewBody:
Jae was a professional and a lovely mannered advisor, i'm so glad I responded to his e-mail. 

He made me feel valued and listened to when discussing the course and explained everything thoroughly and compassionately. I didn't realise a CIPD could be reasonably affordable, something that had deterred me for a few years. I felt reassured, confident and inspired by the end of the interaction and feel he is truly a valuable asset to his team. 

I cannot put into words how thrilled and grateful I am to be on the Level 3 Foundation CIPD course, something i've always wanted the courage to do.

Would definitely recommend Avado to anybody considering a future in HR or L&D.

headline: Swift

However, it is all in the past,come July, I look forward to what i can achieve and learn with and thru Avado for my self growth and my company's.

headline: I have just signed up for the course
reviewBody: I have just signed up for the course, the team was very helpful in ensuring I had the right information for me to make the decision to undertake the course. They were friendly, informative and patient whilst I made up my mind without being pushy. I received all my instructions, terms and conditions, receipts and requisite text books as described and am now looking forward to starting in the next few days.

headline: Hands on, engaging!~
reviewBody: I have just completed a very engaging unit on online and blended learning  - it modelled learner engagement and utility through the design of its tasks that we did as learners on the course. It also asked us to analyse curated examples from the L & D world. The guest speakers were really engaging, and I very much appreciated how quickly we were asked to apply learning to tasks and case studies. Great course for anyone who wants to build their confidence in what's current in L & D for online and blended and develop a toolkit for all possible playforms and tools.

headline: Expectations high
reviewBody:
I successfully completed the IAB level 3 course with this company and was really satisfied with the level of tuition.

Since I have only started the AAT level 4 course I am unable to give an opinion of the quality and standard of the tuition. But my expectations is that this should be a first class course.
I did find the salesman a little patronising though.

headline: Great advisor on phone
reviewBody:
The advisor I spoke with was lady called Mona and she was very helpful. She was friendly, easy to speak to and made you feel at ease! Choosing a course to study can be quite stressful but Mona went through what is in the course and answered all my questions (and I had many) with patience and there was no frustration in her voice. She seemed very caring. 

What i like about Avado (as i did level 2 and 3) is that they send you out hard copy books and i prefer that much more than just online. The reason I havent given 5 star is because I havent started the course yet and would like to see whats in store before rating full marks.

headline: A lot of information to take in over the phone. I wrote everything down.
reviewBody:
A lot of information to take in over the phone which I documented on paper.
Glad I did this as I knew then what was definitely included and what wasn't in the price.
I found registering with the AAT easy with occasional help from student services e.g payment authorisation code for my particular schedule of study.
So far uncomplicated and I'm enjoying reading through the visual learning.
The books arrived very quickly after payment.
I'm really looking forward to the next twelve months.

headline: Helpful and Informative
reviewBody:
Gularana was very patient, professional and helpful. She answered all of my questions and gave me clear and concise answers.

I feel I definitely made the right choice going with AVADO.

I currently have my CIPD Level 3 in HR.
I will be starting the Level 5 on the 9th April and I can't wait! I've been given access to the online home learning portal. I am now able to view the modules, that I need to work on.

I currently work as an HR Administrator. Therefore this online course will not only make more sense to me but also teach me new things about the HR profession.

Knowledge is power and i'm raring to go!

headline: I found AVADO to be extremely helpful…
reviewBody: I found AVADO to be extremely helpful during my initial conversations with them to research companies that provided the course I was interested in.  The idea of a fully digital online course, allowing me to study in my own time is a huge positive for me, although I was apprehensive in how I would have contact with my tutor and have access to study materials, etc.  These concerns were very quickly put aside as AVADO were able to send me examples of their VLC so that I could envisage how everything worked.  I registered for my course and began in January 2018 and have definitely made the right decision.  The tutor's knowledge is excellent and the level of assistance provided to students if required is of the highest standard.  The VLC is a very good learning platform and well structured.  I am really enjoying my course and would not hesitate in recommending AVADO to those who feel an online digital course is for them.

headline: Poor quality study materials and expensive
reviewBody:
I have done Level 2 Bookkeeping distance learning with Avado.
My first initial experience with costumer service and the signing up procedure was actually alright.
I had received an introduction email from my tutor when i started and that was about it. I had no further contact with her as i have not needed her support. 
Every so often if i have not logged  into my VLC for some time, i have received an email from her but it wasn't a personalized email only an automated, generic email with the same subject "we haven't seen you for a while..."
Due to my personal circumstances i fall behind  my studies but i was doing OK. Of course, i have given an estimated 6 months to complete my course. I assumed it (obviously wrongly) that if i finish a month or so later it wouldn't be a big deal. Well, it was as I have been cut off and denied access to my online studies at the beginning of month 7, only weeks before my final exam. 
After calling  the college and paying an additional £45 fee for another month access i was able to log in again and revise for my exam. 
I had no response to any of my emails i have sent to them regarding this matter. The brilliant costumer service was only brilliant at the beginning until they have taken the payment but they were no where near us brilliant to deal with complains. 
My mailbox was flooded with their weekly newsletters and live class alerts loads of them which was not even relevant to my level2 course or class. But i have NOT ONCE received an email to remind me that my initial 6 months studying period is coming to an end nor to remind me to ask for extension if i want to carry on studying. 
Perhaps all these conditions were in the contract with small print and i have fail to read them. Possible. Still, i think along with the hundreds of newsletters they could of schedule in a reminder email too.
The whole experience left me feeling rather bitter so i have decided to sign up with a different college to do Level 3.

I am so pleased i did! 
I have not only received an introducing email from my tutor (they are in fact a group of 3 and not only 1 person) but had to have a personal induction with them to set my goals and study plan.
Now, that i have a comparison i can honestly say that not only Avado`s general support but also their  study materials are  very poor! 
I wish i had the study material for L2 what i have now. It would of made it so much easier for instance to understand the basic principles of double entry, just to mention one subject.
The 2 books i got were the same as the study content on VLC, dry and long texts with no extra workbook.
Honestly, do your research and compare the prices before you sign up with any college. There are many better once than Avado.

headline: Don't be fooled by the star ratings - read the comments
reviewBody:
I'm close to completing a level 5 diploma with Avado and it has not been a good experience. A lot of the learning materials are good but AVADO could put those on line and give access to them for a fraction of the cost for what is supposed to be an interactive experience. I've paid almost 4 1/2 K for this course because its supposed to be a supported and interactive on-line experience. In reality I've found the support to be generally poor  - though there have been exceptions to this. When I've asked questions I've generally had quite superficial answers or no answer at all - even where I've been drawing attention to a wider problem that needs resolving on the site. There are forums which often are not monitored so delegates are asking questions and raising issues with the site that either don't get answered or  are not answered for weeks - by which time assessment deadlines are looming.  One of the main issues is that the material is recycled from previous courses - which is not a problem in itself - but it doesn't seem to be reviewed or updated in the interim. So for example it might ask you to answer a question and say that the definitive answer will be posted in a weeks time.  The answer then doesn't go up because current AVADO staff haven't reviewed the materials so don't  realise that they need to post an answer.   They also don't review group exercises to realise when they are not working so they can flex to the current situation - even when delegates are posting to say the exercise isn't working. They just seem to put the materials up there  - which is why I suggest they could be honest with people and not pretend its interactive and just charge people less.  In the last module they published 3 different dates on the site in 3 different places for the assessment submission then ended up having to give everyone an extension at the last minute because of this. In this module there was an error with the date of the first live class. For the second live class no tutor turned up. When someone posted that they couldn't get on they were advised they could watch the recorded version of the class without realising that the class hadn't actually taken place. So the link posted actually went to a blank classroom  - but AVADO hadn't realised this. Several people made comments on this but there was no response from AVADO until they were sent a screen shot of the empty classroom - at which point they posted a link to a recording to what they said was a previous version of the class that should have run - but was the wrong class - it was in fact an older recording of the class we had already had. In terms of the live class that should have taken place we were told that 'there had been confusion over the scheduling'. Again it took a couple of further comments for AVADO to realise the mistake and put up a previous version of the right class. The option to attend a live interactive session seems to have been taken off the table.  I think its not the mistakes that are the main issue here. Its AVADO'S inability to quickly investigate the issue in any depth so that issues are quickly put right. Instead their initial response is superficial, sometimes rude and unprofessional and takes no account of the fact that many delegates are busy people holding down jobs, running families and trying to fit in course work as and when only to find that the resources and support are not there or up to scratch when they need them. 

Its interesting that AVADO gets such high scores on this site but if you look at the comments  a lot of them are from new people who have just signed up. So what they are commenting on is the sign up process - the bit where AVADO put resources in - the sales pitch to get people signed up and get the money in. After that in my experience it doesn't really  deliver.

headline: Avado experience
reviewBody: Avado learning tool so much time to find out about me and what my needs from doing an accounting qualification were so they could give me sound advice. They advised the AAT and talked me through all the opportunities it opens up and why it was relevant to me and the other qualifications I had been looking at were not required. They taked me through enrolling and the whole process has been easy, smooth and quick. I have now started my course and am thoroughly enjoying it. I was nervous with distant learning that I would get no support but that’s the total opposite I have only just started and already feel a huge amount of support. My tutor gave an introductory live class online last night, she had over 100 of us and in the hour she took us through everything and managed to answer everyone’s questions. She even managed to remember people when she got to certain topics they had asked questions on earlier she referred to the individual by name - I have no idea how she did managed it! Really looking forward to the course and from my experience so far cannot reccomend them highly enough.

Today I have already started studying and I can tell you that it is one of the best platforms to study on. They explain everything properly for you to understand everything, you are also tested after every chapter to see for yourself if you have actually studied good enough or if you should reread the chapter and there are definitely plenty of other things that I love in this course. headline: I rang up for enrolment to the next …
reviewBody:
I rang up for enrollment to the next stage of the course.
initially I phoned the student services which took ages to answer the call.
Eventually, when the phone was answered by one of the assistant to direct me to the right person. I was put through to Evie Lording (Post graduate enrolment consultant) who was quite prompt in sending me the Course details and concerned fees breakdown.  Once I read through the sent detail it didn't take me long to decide. I phoned back on various numbers provided. Again it took so long for the student services to answer the phone. When the call was answered, Pamela answered and took the message from me. It appeared that M/s Lording was on leave.
On return Pamela must have passed the message. ms Lording has sent me an email. On Thursday it didn't take long to complete the enrolment process. I think my frustrated experience is with the student services. Whenever I call, pre recorded message greets you and it takes so long before anyone answers, then the direction of transferring to the right person takes place.

headline: Excellent Service !
reviewBody: Excellent! Great service by Mona who handled my entire application and answered all the questions I had, regarding the course with alot of patience. She helped me choose the best course and increased my confidence by highlighting the benefits of studying with AVADO. Thank you, Mona. You're Awesome.

She was very professional and took her time to run me through the details of the course. I would recommend the enrollment process to anyone keen on pursuing CIPD.

headline: Incompetent
reviewBody: Currently studying with AVADO and I find myself frustrated all the time when it comes to contacting them. Errors in the text books and errors on the practice questions.  I booked an exam early last week and they still have not sent me an exam confirmation through and have not replied to my emails which I sent earlier this week.  I came across two difficult questions in my past two exams and emailed the tutors with my queries, all they could say was 'I cannot answer this without having a look at the question, but fingers crossed for you' despite me detailing the question and information given and said I 'must have remembered the question incorrectly' and reluctantly tried to help me understand the process of answering the questions. They advised that I must find a similar question on AAT for them to look at and then they would be 'happy to speak with me'. Not organised and VERY unhelpful for the amount of money I have paid.

headline: I went with Avado for my AAT Level 3 …
reviewBody:
I went with Avado for my AAT Level 3 after I had done my level 2 when they were Home Learning College.  What a nightmare it has been.
Errors in all of the physical books, errors on the online knowledge checks.  Tutors who don't respond. Exams not booked in properly.  It's hard to pin point something that was right with this course.

I even did my final exam which was riddled with problems.  I did that at the beginning of September, got confirmation of my pass on the 19th October (which I had to look elsewhere for resources to actually help me to learn) and I am still waiting for Tutor Marked assignments to actually be marked back from August.

Keep emailing student services and the tutors and you don't get a response, even when you do they say they are going to sort it and then don't.

The amount of errors riddled in this entire course, along with the other levels as well is outrageous.  Most of the studying comes from working out where THEY have gone wrong and trying to work back from there, along with buying materials from elsewhere to help you learn.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY WITH THESE PEOPLE.

I have done twice now and will not be doing for any future courses that I am going to take

headline: Disappointed
reviewBody:
I am finishing now a course with them and I'm quite disappointed in the experience.
You're supposed to learn at your own pace but although they take your money, you have to wait a few months before you can start the course.
When I asked my tutor for information about the course like the time I had to complete it and the deadline for the exams she told me to check the introductory live class. That class didn't have any of the information I asked for.( to this day I haven't got any of that information) It would have been so much helpful if I would have known about the resources on the aat website! They pressure you to buy the membership but they don't bother to give you more info.You may wonder why I didn't look into it: I only had a full time job, 6 days a week and my university. That's why I paid so much money to have information on a "plate", a hustle free experience.

They put me in the same group as the accounting students (I've signed up for bookkeeping) which means I got all their updates..it got confusing at times.
During the course I received 2 emails suggesting that I was behind the studying schedule although, like I said before, its supposed to be learning at your own pace. 

I never had time to join live classes. Apparently there are recordings. I could never find them. After I looked for the links everywhere I decided to ask student services for them and no one bothered to give them to me. They only told me where they are supposed to be...

From what I understand tutors in other companies check your progress and your knowledge checks results and they recommend to you if you should take the exam or practice more. None of that here. After a while you get a 'auto response' type of email saying you should request your exam... there should be a lot more help from the tutors especially for people like me who decided to try something new ..
Should I mention the mistakes in the material and in the knowledge checks? 

Before I decided to write this I read other reviews. Everyone is happy with the way avado approached them in the beginning. I was happy as well but let's be honest here: those are just marketing strategies...

I'll leave you with the latest news from them: it takes 16 WEEKS for your diploma to be sent out!!

headline: For the amount of money this course …
reviewBody: For the amount of money this course costs there is not much interaction or lessons. As for flexible with assignments being on holiday and the other side for the whole two week deadline and not being in the country is not a valid reason and extra £100 fee added on top of the course (scam to get more money out of you) after taking 3 weeks to get a straight answer from anybody on this situation, they have lowered the fee to £50 as a good will gesture still ridiculous if you ask me. Currently studying still but become really disheartened by the service I've received.

headline: I was very impressed with the …
reviewBody: I was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff on the telephone who gave me plenty of information about the courses available and the content. My rating would be 5 stars if it hadn't been for my start date being mixed up by a month in the first email I got from my tutor.

headline: 5* review for Avado
reviewBody: Avado were very good at communicating prior to the course start date and have continued to be helpful ever since. The staff are friendly, professional and efficient. I wouldn't have any hesitations in recommending to others to use Avado in future.

headline: Overall the service provided has been …
reviewBody: Overall the service provided has been highly professional. The one  thing which did leave me disappointed was that I hoped we would receive something tangible in the post to support our learning. When I studied at the OU they sent a learning pack which really helped.

headline: I don't feel the support offered was …
reviewBody: I don't feel the support offered was good enough. The amount of money the course has cost and they refuse to give a partial refund after I have only completed 2 units and am not continuing with the course. they tell you there is a chance to re-take all failed units at the end of the course - what they fail to tell you however is that there is an additional fee of £100 PER UNIT to pay. The course was almost £3000 - there should be a lot more support available and not just Monday to Friday - when studying from home, you are not just studying mon-fri 9 - 5 - you are studying evenings and weekends as you are at work during working hours! The course also recommends 8-10 hours of studying per week - I did that just on a Sunday - it isn't feasible to do this course at home and the lack of support for the money my employer has paid is disgusting. I will keep appealing this until we at least agree on refunding half of the money that my employer paid.

headline: Friendly

Friendly, knowledge and very helpful .... very supportive and great guidance... made me feel I wasn't alone on my journey .... always someone there. 

Thank you

headline: Mis-sold product
reviewBody:
I was informed that the course would include membership fees and extra costs which turned out to be false. When I asked to cancel the course I was informed despite being mis-sold and without being able to prove I was informed of these costs and being only 5 days outside the cancellation period I would be unable to do so.

I have spent many hours trying to reach an agreeable outcome but suffer slow response rates and also the inability to acknowledge the proof I send through as back up to my points.

I also have had E-mails ignored on this matter which have gone unanswered.

I would recommend avoiding this company and looking elsewhere.

Thanks,

Matt
